Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel / Amazing Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: bexnate
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Dallas Renaissance for 3-day weekend, and could not have been happier with the lovely hotel & restaurant. Spotless room, fantastic rooftop pool & free laundry. Close to Love Field. The front desk staff was excellent. Go to the restaurant for organic "farm to fire" food.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal value. If you've got a car, stay here not Downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Trusplatter
Reviews.Content: I was a little dubious of staying here since it isn't central enough if you want to walk and it almost seemed too cheap - but that's the genius of staying here, you save loads of money and the room we had was great. The room was way beyond my expectations as was as good as some 5 star hotels. There's a pool on the roof and a small fitness room too. If you have a room facing towards the city the view at night is a sight worth seeing. You'll easily pay double for a room like this if you stay downtown and then you don't get the bonus of free parking. The hotel isn't far from town, it only took us 15 minutes to drive from the hotel to downtown. Not walkable (you're in Texas after all!), but not a problem being that bit further away for the money you've saved. My only criticism is the price of the food, especially for breakfast. Don't get me wrong, the food really was great - we had dinner here a couple of times and all the food we had was really good. You'll definitely find better value if you venture to a restaurant. And the hotel staff are knowledgable about places to eat in Dallas. The hotel breakfast, although good, is way overpriced (the buffet is anyway) - and I don't think this was worth the money we paid. If you do stay here, when you book (direct via their website) you can give a preference of floor location (low or high). Definitely select a high level - if you're on the city side you'll get the view.

Reviews.Title: “Try this business-class hotel for a weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: WorldwidetravelerUsa
Reviews.Content: We've stayed twice at this Renaissance on Marriott weekend rates and it has been a great value each time. The rooms have been spacious and clean and the staff has been accomodating and helpful. The lobby and adjacent restaurant/bar offer a mix of Texan and contemporary decor that everyone seems to enjoy. The health club and outside pool on the 30th floor are very clean. The free parking lot in back of the hotel is large enough for RV's. Best of all, this hotel is in a great location for exploring the Metroplex. It is only a few blocks from the Medical/Market Center stations for the TRE train to Fort Worth and the DART light rail to Downtown and other parts of Dallas. If you prefer to drive, Wycliff Ave. offers quick access to Oak Lawn, Highland Park, Turtle Creek, and the McKinney Ave. district. It's also easy to hop on to I-35 or the North Dallas Tollway. Our only disappointment has been the charge of $ 12.95 per day for using the hotel's Internet service.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful welcome!”
Reviews.Author: Carl H
Reviews.Content: My first stop on my first trip to America. Lovely welcoming from the staff, really friendly and efficient. The hotel is really clean and the rooms are great value for money. Brilliant views of the city the higher up your room is too!

Reviews.Title: “Average for a Renaissance, but Good for Most Hotels”
Reviews.Author: Dallas37
Reviews.Content: When I think Renaissance, I think "Higher End". While it may not be the highest of caliber, I expect a bit more than the average Holiday Inn or the like. With that said....Renaissance was average when you think of what it should be or what you should expect. I stayed only one night, while in Dallas for the 2012 Auto Show. I will point out that when you search for Downtown Dallas Hotels, this one comes up. It is not IN downtown, but it is in Market Center, which is about a 4 or 5 minute drive from actual Downtown. Overall, The hotel was clean and customer service was adequate. I have to point out that I have no serious concerns nor any "real" complaints. But I have a couple gripes about the general stay, as follows: I am a Marriott Rewards Gold Elite Member...I checked into a King Room on a requested high floor. I was placed on the 19th of 30 floors. That was good for me. However, the room was a connecting room...which I despise. I called down, requesting a non-connecting room. After a quick check, I was informed that there were no non-connecting rooms equal to the room I have. As a Rewards Member, who has stayed at Marriotts over 30 nights a year for the last 2 years...I expected an offer for an upgrade or the like...nothing of that nature came. The agent was nice about it, but nothing could be done. I'm not trying to be "high and mighty" but it seemed an easy request for a long time customer. A second concern....the rooftop pool. In order to get there, you travel by elevator to the 30th floor. Then you walk to a stairwell door. Beyond the door you enter a very utilitarian stairwell....black metal stairs, with cream-colored walls...that lead you up to the gym and pool area. This was not fitting with the hotel at all. Frankly I was shocked at the route. Why have they not changed this?? Weird to me. But...the pool area was nice, heated pool was a good extra. Finally, when going into downtown, I searched and then asked if there was car or shuttle service to downtown...there was none. I would even consider paying a bit for the service, but nothing offered. I asked a doorman, who quickly said "no". A cab is about $10 each way. Overall, the hotel was very clean, the room was good size and clean. The bathroom had 2 sinks, one inside the bathroom, and one outside....so this was a good bonus. The shower seemed ill fitted for the space....not sure what it was, but it seemed out of place. Otherwise, good, Aveda products, nice, clean appointments. I had no REAL problems and if someone wanted to stay there, I would not discourage them. However, I think I would suggest others before I suggested this one. With the likes of Adolphus, Hilton, and Magnolia within a couple miles...and prices that are not much more, I would think Renaissance would step up the "details".

Reviews.Title: “Updated Rooms, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelRod
Reviews.Content: One of the easiest hotels to find in Dallas, right off I35 near AA Center and Victory Plaza. Recently updated hotel rooms and lobby. Restaurant I would rate as average for this level of hotel. Good news it plenty of great restaurants from 2-3 miles away. Rooftop (31st floor) pool and gym. For sure will stay again The massive Hilton Anatole is across the street. Big advantage for the Renaissance is that you can go from your car to any room in 3-4 minutes its a tall hotel, at the Anatole it can literally be nearly 10 min from the car to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Costumer Service”
Reviews.Author: Nina A
Reviews.Content: We went there to visit our new born nephew who had breathing complications The bar was great I enjoyed my meal .Concierge associate was very friendly and gave us great recomendation for a nice steak house .My only down comment is about Front desk staff they where too busy having a converstation with the female manager that looked way to personal than assist us .

Reviews.Title: “Renaissance Hotel -”
Reviews.Author: Richgray68
Reviews.Content: Based on past experience of staying at the Renaissance I decided to stay there again although it meant driving 10 miles farther for work everyday then I would have had to if I stayed at another hotel. This is a great hotel (could use an updated gym) but the staff from the front desk to the lounge are all very courteous and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Staff Members who treat you like family”
Reviews.Author: Jim L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had to fly into Dallas without very much notice due to our newly born Granddaughter having some serious medical complications that required a long stay at the Children's Hospital right up the road. I am retired from selling Medical Devices for the past 30 years and spent much of my time on the road. (Sometimes upwards of twenty days a month) That being said I think I know what makes a good hotel stay for both the business traveler or someone traveling for personal issues. We chose the Renaissance only because it was located very close to the Children's Hospital where our Granddaughter was going to be staying. I usually stayed at Hiltons when I was still working but this came highly recommended so I decided to give it a shot. Boy am I glad we stayed there! The very first day when we arrived I was given access to the 27th floor that is reserved for Gold and Elite members. I was also given access to the Gold/Eilte Members Lounge which was a Godsend! The first night we arrived we decided to stop by for a quick drink to relax after a long day of traveling. We were the only ones there as it was a very slow night and struck up a conversation with a Ms Erin Dowell. She was so incredibly sweet and great to talk to. We told her why we were there and what our Granddaughter was going to be going through. From that moment on Erin made sure that all of our needs were met and attended to. Every morning or evening she would check in with us to make sure everything was to our satisfaction and if she could help us in any other way. She even helped my wife with a few things on her own time to help us acclimate to being away from home for so long. I honestly do not think we would have kept our sanity during this very trying time had Erin not been there to help us. From now on I will make sure to always stay at the Marriot family of hotels. I used to be a loyal Hilton customer but Erin has shown me what true customer service and attention to detail is all about. I cannot thank Erin and the rest of the Renaissance Dallas staff enough for helping us through probably the most difficult time in our lives. Thankfully our Granddaughter is doing great and has made a full recovery. We will be coming back to Dallas often to visit and play with her as often as possible. We will also be coming back to stay at the Renaissance Dallas Hotel to visit the staff that treated us as family during this very difficult experience. Thank you Ms. Dowell for being there when we really needed it. You are so much more than a wonderful employee. We also consider you a newly found friend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Business Traveler”
Reviews.Author: William F
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the country and spend about 15-20 days on the road per month. Many hotels pay lip service to taking care of the business traveler but few actually do. I have been to the Renaissance Dallas Hotel quite a few times and it is now my "go to" hotel of choice when I need to conduct work in the "Big D" The main reason for continuing to give the Renaissance my business is their attention to detail. The restaurant is superb and their location is second to none. However the main reason they still keep receiving my patronage is the fact that they go out of their way to make sure your stay is comfortable and relaxed. The last time I stayed there a personal emergency came up that was really going to put me in a major bind. While on the concierge floor I had the pleasure of meeting Erin Dowell who could immediately tell that something was wrong. She asked if there was something she could do for me and boy did she deliver. Erin personally assisted me in arranging a few details and really went out of her way to make sure that I could focus on work and not have this trip go to waste. Above all else she is the reason I will continue to go back to this fine establishment. Big kudos to Erin and the rest of the Renaissance Dallas Hotel Staff. Thank you for going out of your way to make my stay on the road much more pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and staff”
Reviews.Author: thomasstack
Reviews.Content: I had a great week at the Renaissance hotel in Dallas. Very nice rooms, great facilities and really helpful staff. A special shoutout to Dustin at the frontdesk who fixed my mavericks seats and the vallet guys who were just terrific!

Reviews.Title: “Still My Go To Hotel for This Area of Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: Still my go to hotel for this area of Dallas. Very nice. This trip I was pleasantly surprised by a complementary tray of chips and salsa, candied walnuts, chocolates, and gummy bears waiting for me in the room, along with an upgrade to Marriott Rewards gold status. Nice touch. Beautiful decor; great staff. Room tip: Get as far away from the elevators as you can. When they arrive on the floor there's a shrill beeping that pierces through even the low fan noise in the nearby sleeping rooms. I hadn't noticed this before - perhaps because I was farther away from the elevators. This trip I also noticed the train whistles more. Maybe better to ask for the side of the hotel NOT facing Childrens' Medical Center?

Reviews.Title: “Central Location”
Reviews.Author: keldes
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for business. I chose it because it was centrally located to all of the places I had to visit. They also had a great deal which allowed me to have a suite for the same price as a standard room. Check in was quick and easy, they treated us like we were special asking my colleague and I if they could bring anything up to our rooms at all that would make our stay more comfortable. The suite was fairly large with most of the space being taken up by the living room, the bedroom was smaller and the bath a little too small. This property has been recently renovated so everything was in good condition. Since we were on the club level we checked out that lounge. It is nicely laid out has plenty of beverages, snacks, seating and computer work stations. I did not use the gym on this visit but was told it is small but has nice equipment. We did not eat here but had a drink at the bar that was very lively for a Thursday night. If you need a centrally located hotel you cannot go wrong with this property, it is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Impressed with Hotel and staff.”
Reviews.Author: Charles S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were impressed from the moment we arrived. The Hotel staff immediately made us feel welcomed. Our room was spacious and friendly. The fresh fruits and personally prepared omelets for breakfest topped off the dining experience. Everyone at the Hotel made this a stay to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Asador Restaurant & Lounge, Renaissance Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joe M
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler, both internationally and within the US to over 65 destinations annually, I'd have to rate the revamped Restaurant and Lounge at the Renaissance as one of the "Top 10" Hotel restaurants in the world! The Renaissance in Dallas got it right when the remodeled this place. The decor is chic, without going overboard, the ambiance is both lively and modern romantic, and the menu selections and food are absolutely fantastic! The food is fresh (locally procurred) and favorable, and a has variety of selections without being too overwhelming. The grilled brussel sprouts with pork in a balsamic reduction is out of this world. The crab dip, a favorite of my wife's, is also great--with a very limited amount of cream cheese and ton's of crab meet wonderfully blended. All the food is prepared in an open grill/kitchen along one wall. They have a nice selection of infused spirits at the bar they do themselves in-house. The bar itself is a site to see, adding to the overall ambiance to the lounge. Despite having access to the club lounge, I much prefer dining and have cocktails in the "Asador Bar." Expect to see this bar highlighted soon in the best travel magazines. PS. The hotel and entire staff are outstanding, and by far the nicest hotel in the Dallas Market Center area.

Reviews.Title: “The freindliest people!”
Reviews.Author: Walter S
Reviews.Content: The Concierge lounge at the Renaissance Dallas Hotel was very impressive! Not only do you get the typical selection of food and beverage, but for breakfast they have a chef cooking fresh omelets! To go along with all that, add in the wonder service and friendly staff like Erin Dowell that really tops off the entire experience! Everyone should put this hotel on the top of their list when visiting Dallas for business or pleasure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall dissappointed”
Reviews.Author: mb042085
Reviews.Content: My friends had always raved about this hotel so I decided to stay there this trip instead of the Anatole. The restaurant/bar was horrible the bartender barely acknowledged my presence my beer was constantly empty, the food was bland and sent it back. The executive lounge was worse the girl whose name escapes me seemed unattentive and had a bad attitude. The only bright spot was the room service girl she was very friendly and unlike most of the other staff seemed in a good mood I think her name was yesy. She's what got you 1 star instead of 0. I'll be staying at the Hilton again

Reviews.Title: “It was just OK!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aprilerain
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot mostly for business. The hotel is nice and the staff was great. But for some reason this hotel didn't give me my Marriott points because my company paid for my stay even though I stayed across the street at the Sheraton the previous week and didn't have this problem. My company has paid before at other Marriott's and I was given the points for my stay. Needless to say, I contacted Marriott about this and they still refused telling me that the hotel can give them to you if they choose too; If they don't you can't get them if some one else pays. Well since Marriott would rather lose a customer for life then to give them the points they earn from a legimate stay so be it. I stay well over 50 nights a year in hotels. I will give me business to other hotel companies.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: DaveH-NYC
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance is a great hotel and since they have so many rooms you'll often get a really good rate. The staff is very professional especially the front desk, bell men and in the executive lounge. Also, there's free parking and it is located conveniently on 35, very close to uptown and access to DFW airport and Love. I've stayed here many times and always have a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “great time..”
Reviews.Author: dee kay c
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for a stars game and thought it was great.. the rooms were big and comfortable.. enjoyed a few drinks at the lounge bar.. really liked that when we went outside and were asking if there was a shuttle or should we call a cab to take us to the game, there was a limo driver with suburban right there handy.. he took us, then gave us his card.. came quickly when we called after the game- so easy!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good option”
Reviews.Author: cosmopoliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights in November and had a special rate which included breakfast. The room was very nice, spacious and clean. The people at the front desk where also very nice and helpful. However, I cannot rate this hotel with 5 stars because of 2 points: - I was a bit disappointed by the variety at the breakfast, especially if you consider the regular price they charge. - One morning we came back from breakfast and found the plumber in our bathroom deblocking the drain even though the "Please do not disturb" sign was hanging outside our door and our drain was working perfectly. When we asked who had called him not even he could really give an answer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deniuh
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms at the Renaissance this month. One Double and the other King. Both rooms were well appointed. The Double was huge with a sitting area, desk/business area. Since we had a 4 yr old in tow, the space worked out really well. The King was much smaller so if you have kids opt for the larger room. The hotel is modern and sleek and was newer looking than we were expecting. I would opt to stay here everytime I am in Dallas vs a Marriott or their related brands (besides Ritz & JW). The only downside was the parking. It was very limited and you had to drive around several times before you could find a spot. It is close to the Dallas Aquarium. A Denny's is right around the corner if you want a quick breakfast. Room service was prompt, although they forgot half of my order the 2nd time around. No worries, I called and they fixed it right away. Great time was had by all at the Renaissance.(We stayed on the 21st floor - great city views!!

Reviews.Title: “My 'go to' hotel when in Dallas on Biz”
Reviews.Author: DTerryNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: I travel to Dallas frequently on biz trips (over the past 4yrs) and have stayed in many hotels there.....but the Renaissance has become my hotel of choice. It is conveniently located, has easy ample parking, and has the right mix of service and style to not be stuffy and very comfortable. The staff is top notch and friendly, particularly Erin Dowell and the folks the work in the concierge lounge. Housekeeping, desk, and valet staff have also always been great.

Reviews.Title: “Well located option”
Reviews.Author: procpr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance this past weekend. Overall, the rooms were nice and the downstairs restaurant, Asador, quite cozy. Even though the common areas look refurbished and the lobby is very elegant, the rooms look a little tired. The bathrooms are tiny and the old-school, circa 1980's faucets were a definite gripe. Getting the temperature right in the room was a hassle!!! Lastly, if you enjoy a quiet night's rest, ask for a room on a high floor. There is a commuter train that passes close to the hotel and its conductors seem to love to chime the horn constantly. Overall, the price was right and the service courteous and efficient. I would come back here if the rate is under $129.

Reviews.Title: “First stay at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: Marc L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance this past weekend for the first time and I must say it is an excellent hotel. The front desk staff was efficient and friendly. As a business traveler, the speedy/friendly check-in process is always appreciated. A special thank you to Erin Dowell, she went above and beyond the call as our personal concierge for the weekend! She recommended some great restaurants and attractions for our groups to enjoy while in TX. I will certainly stay at the Renaissance when I return to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Each stay just gets better!”
Reviews.Author: Mel1962
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have now stayed at this hotel three times this year! I wasn't too impressed with the first stay, but since the hotel was centrally located between the places we were needing to go during the trip, I decided to book a 2nd stay with them. BOY!!!! Was I glad that I did! We had a corner strangely shaped room, but it was very quaint & we LOVE it! We were only there for one night, but everything met with our satisfaction completely. Now, the third, and most recent visit ... we had a multi-purpose reason for this trip ... part medical visits & some pleasure (Dallas Cowboy game!). Our room was on the 16th floor with a GREAT view of downtown Dallas. The room was larger than our last one, which I was thankful for, since we had four nights booked, instead of one. We really didn't have a lot of pressing things to do each morning, so we put our "privacy" sign on the door & we never even heard housekeeping, even though I know they were cleaning rooms around us. Our room was always neat & tidy when we arrived back at the hotel each evening. One of the evenings, my husband wanted some milk. Sadly, even the little hotel "store" did not have any in the refrigerator case. As we were walking toward the elevators, one of the staff noticed we had walked out of the store area & asked if he could help us with anything. To which my husband replied, "Where can I get some milk?" I was figuring he was going to suggest that we go to the hotel restaurant and ask, but instead, he asked us to wait a moment. When he returned, he was carrying 5 cartons of milk!! Wow! That was awesome & it lasted my husband the entire stay! Everyone we encountered was very friendly and willing to assist. I'll find it hard to book a stay anywhere else & I have to be in Dallas a minimum of twice a year! Thanks Renaissance Dallas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: adnan s
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel on and off for the about 1 year and i have to say that they do a really good job of taking care of the quests 1- The rooms are always clean 2: Front desk staff is always welcoming. 3: The club lounge is the best place to hangout; the food is fresh and drinks are real good. Erin dowell and kristen russel do a really good job in keeping the business customers happy. 4: Room service is always on time I would recommend any business traveler to check this place out. The rates are also reasonable. Adnan

Reviews.Title: “Love this place....!!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda Z
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Renaissance for a few years. We have always thought it was a great hotel and the service is awesome. It is even better now with all of the upgrades and reconstruction that has taken place. This last time we went......Tree decorated and music playing.....Lobby is really nice and I thoght it was great before the renovation...!!!!! Kuddos to the ladies in the Renaissance lounge for their kind service..!! Thank you Amanda Z

Reviews.Title: “It's a little above standard”
Reviews.Author: trefold
Reviews.Content: Good parking, friendly staff, a little 80s interior, ok rooms, good beds, small but sufficient bathroom, rooftop pool and gym above average standard, nice dinner at Asador (the hotel restaurant) but remember you will have to pay extra for continental breakfast, and a little extra on top of that again if you want warm breakfast (no I'm not kidding). All in all an ok stay but nothing more. Would be 3 star in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing for a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: tayriley
Reviews.Content: generally this place is nice. but the entire time, i kept finding things to be disappointing, given that this is a 4 star hotel, and i've stayed at 3 star hotels that were better. here are the gripes- - my one king bed room was very small. the door to the bathroom opens straight into the side of the bathtub, so u can't shower with the door open. which wouldn't be a big deal, except THERE IS NO FAN IN THE BATHROOM. - the room service menu is TINY. there was barely anything on the menu, AND when i called for breakfast at 11am, they said i couldnt order because breakfast ends at 11am. fine, can i order something else? no, lunch starts in 30 minutes, so i'd have to wait a whole hour if i wanted to order lunch. suffice to say, this was how it went all weekend. they werent outright rude, but not particularly accommodating either. -a light bulb was out in one of the lamps when i first arrived. it took forever for them to send up a tech guy to change it out. - there was no stationary in my room, no envelopes, no postcards. when i called to have some sent up, they just brought a few small cards w/ the renaissance logo on it...i dont even know if they print proper letter stationary. - the parking lot is a hassle, and there is no good way to walk to the entrance. u have to go around a fountain, which means you have to constantly watch to make sure you don't get run over by all the arriving cars of guests and taxis. - the rooftop pool is beyond disappointing. it is tiny, super shallow, and the whole point of a rooftop pool is to have a great view, but the concrete walls around the pool are so high that there is absolutely no view. it would've been no different to have the pool on ground level. also, it closes at 11pm. if i remember correctly, the pool at the renaissance austin is open 24/7. the one upside is that the lobby is GORGEOUS. i definitely wish i had an excuse to hang out in the lobby, because it is the only part of this hotel that i would say fulfills its 4 star rating. i likely will not return to this hotel. for the price, i could stay somewhere much nicer in terms of accommodations and it is important to me that there is a good 24hr menu.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Eric R
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this facility extensively for over 3 years. Anytime , I travel to Dallas, this is where I stay. If I dont get to stay, then Im extremely dissapointed.... Nice facility, convenient acces to all major freeways. The most impressive thing about the renaisance is the People. They are off the charts in regard to making you feel at home and for providing service. Only thing that dissapoints is that they got rid of their Starbucks !!

Reviews.Title: “High Quality near Downtown, Love Field, AA Center”
Reviews.Author: Aaron A
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the "Ren" every week for a year now. The lobby and restaurant have been updated for a very cool feel. Rooms are quiet and clean. Comfy beds, big TVs, and great views of downtown. Reliable van service from Love Field, and only 5 minutes from downtown. Awesome rooftop pool on 30th floor. Downsides: gym is on 30th floor, and not big at all. Highway/train noise on occasion. Overall, very nice place, and the staff is always fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad...”
Reviews.Author: JackandMaddie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights on business. The hotel seemed very nice. The night I arrived the restaurant bar area seemed very busy and popular. Check in was fast and easy. My room was very nice. Parking is free. It was best to park in the bigger lot in the back though because the spots in the front were very tight. The front staff was very nice and helpful. They also helped me and a coworker use a kiosk to schedule a shuttle for the airport. The business center only had two computers and we had to wait quite a while to use one. A lot of other people were waiting too. Sleep quality wasn't too great though because it is very close to the train tracks and I could hear trains sounding their horns all night long - and I even sleep with earplugs! I didn't find the location to be very good. There was nothing within walking distance, such as restaurants or shops. And I was disappointed that there wasn't a starbuks in the hotel or nearby... Overall this is a nice hotel, but I wouldn't choose to stay here on vacation. I stayed here on a business trip and it met my needs just fine.

Reviews.Title: “This was the best hotel ever with a perfect staff”
Reviews.Author: labigal9
Reviews.Content: This was 1 of the most pleasant hotels srays that I've ever had in my 45 years experience in working and traveling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Peter N
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the last few months. In addition I have stayed at other hotels in Dallas. My experience here has been exceptional and I highly recommend this hotel for travelers. In addition to the great accomodations, the staff is excellent. We are always treated well and enjoy our stay. Erin Dowell, Business Development Coordinator, made our more recent trip even better with her friendliness and professionalism. Her personal touch with those on the Concierge floor did not go unnoticed by anyone present. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhere between average and very good”
Reviews.Author: suswil
Reviews.Content: The very good: the bed was very comfortable. The view was incredible. The average: I had five meals from room service, and asked for specific things - no orange juice, but apple juice, mayo on my burger, instead mustard. I did not receive any of my request-just received whatever was their usual meal. In another instance, I get a knock on my door from a random man-ends up he's the tech guy and apparently some of the channels didn't work on the tv in the room. I never received a call letting me know that someone from service was coming to the room. Also, wireless costs $12/a day. Would I stay there again? Yes, absolutely. Although I didn't receive any of my food requests, the food was really good. All staff was very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Always consistently great”
Reviews.Author: Robert H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times. Always a great experience. They had my room keys ready when I arrived. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are modern and ideal for business travel. centrally located so easy to get anywhere in Dallas/Ft. Worth. This is the kind of stay that makes me a loyal Marriott Rewards member. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: Bill W
Reviews.Content: As noted in other reviews, the hotel is located a short drive from downtown in more of the convention part of town. Itâ€™s easy access to highway, though, makes it very convenient to get around. The lobby is very nice and the staff is spectacular. I received great help from both the front desk staff and the concierge. I stayed on the Club Level on the upper floorsâ€”although I have no idea if and when the Club itself is ever open. The rooms are older but have been recently renovated. The bathrooms are tiny and the showers in particular show their age (very early 90s). The room itself was spacious, too spacious actually. I had a king sized bed, a couch, and a workstation and the room was still 1/3 emptyâ€”which was a problem since they didnâ€™t give me a table or chairs. Example, they offer room service but it would have been impossible for me to eat it since my room was missing the staples for any meal (something to sit and eat on). If only they could use the empty space to enlarge the bathroom and give me something to eat on. The furniture and bed/bedding are new and comfortable. I was visiting on vacation and it was my first time at this hotel, so it was disappointing that my room was missing the standard binder that tells you about the hotel and the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Restaurant Ever?”
Reviews.Author: Descarte
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Dallas has a lot going for it. It is well situated for travelers coming into Dallas from Love Field. It is reasonably close to downtown. It offers great views of the city. The rooms are on the small side, and many of the features are hard to find, such as the hair blower (in the closet in a black bag) and the refrigerator (in a bedside table cabinet). The bathroom does not measure up either in terms of actual square footage or level of luxury to some competitor hotels. But on balance this is a wonderful hotel. However, of all the features of the Renaissance, the best by far is the Asador Restaurant. This is one of the best restaurants I have ever had the pleasure of experiencing! I ended up eating all meals in Dallas right there during my weekend visit, because the odds were long against anywhere else matching the food offerings and ambiance of the Asador. The breakfast buffet featured both a fruit bar and a hot bar, and the chef could fix an omelet or anything else you requested. The fruit was so fresh and varied that choices seemed unlimited. Presentation of meals was divine, the prime rib to die for. Go there for the restaurant even if you are staying in nearby hotels.

Reviews.Title: “What a great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: montiep
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Dallas 2 yrs ago for our anniversary. We had a great concert to attend as well. I wrote a review of how the staff of this hotel went above and beyond for us. Long story short, after 2 attempts, they upgraded us to the suite. It was our first time to enjoy this kind of lifestyle. We loved it. So for our company Christmas party, which we give 4 nice gifts for our employees to draw from, I contacted Cathy at the hotel. We wanted to buy a gift certificate for one nights stay. Well, after speaking to her GM, and since it would be an open gift certificate and unsure when it would be used, they did not know how much to charge us. Well, they ended up just giving us the certificate! I was plesantly suprised. This will be such a great gift for one of our employees. These folks at the Renaissance are truely awesome people. Anyone who gets to stay here is in for a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Manteno
Reviews.Content: I was expecting a great hotel and service based off the ranking. But I have since found they were giving away Marriott points if you sent in a good review thus improving their ranking I think. I agree with others. I check in and they give me my key. He pulls it back and takes out the password for the internet. He said you have to be a Gold member and I was 9 nights away. So they charge you $13 a night. I agree with others, a rip-off. Front desk staff was unfriendly. Get to my room and a wierd smell. It smell like cigarette smoke. I called down and they told me they could move me, but I would have move down 13 floors. I told them I would stay a bit to try and get used to it. After awhile I decided it would be best to move. I call down and they then tell me they have no other rooms. I did not check in until 10:30. There was also a big hole in the drapes, not what would you would expect from a hotel rated this high. Then called down to see if I could check out an hour or two later. They told me I would have to pay another half nights rate. I then asked for a manager. They allowed a later check out then. The room was clean and not bad, it was just the service was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Marriott Experience, but the rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: rocketsfan007
Reviews.Content: I would consider Marriott my preferred brand of hotel, and stay at them whenever I can. The Renaissance Dallas lives up to the standards of quality and service I have come to expect from Marriott. The lobby at this property is beautiful and I was served at the front desk immediately. The property also provides ample free parking, so you can avoid paying for the valet. As I understand the hotel was renovated fairly recently and the quality of the room was excellent. My only complaint in this regard was that I felt the bathroom space was too small and cramped. This probably has to do with the fact that it is an older building. I also have a "high floor" request as part of my Marriott rewards profile. However in a 20+ story building I was given a room on the 4th floor! This was the most disappointing aspect of the trip, but very minor. I would also like to point out that the directions I got from Google told me to exit one too late which caused me to loop back around on the feeder road. This is not Marriott's fault, but I wanted to point it out as a friendly reminder to readers.

Reviews.Title: “Asador at the Renaissance Dallas, TX”
Reviews.Author: ellaskilaki
Reviews.Content: What a nice hotel. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. A little far from downtown and no shuttle except to Love Field but the hotel restaurant Asador ( Farm to table) was excellent. Excellent wine selection. And some interesting dishes. Did not even have to leave the hotel to find good food. The meeting space is very nice but holding meetings there is very expensive .

Reviews.Title: “Pick another hotel”
Reviews.Author: Abzats
Reviews.Content: Strong unpleasant odor in the room. Unfriendly, helpless staff.

Reviews.Title: “very nice alternative to pricey Dallas hotels!”
Reviews.Author: SMUMOM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance while visiting our college-age son. We usually book rooms at the Palomar but this trip none were available. We booked a great rate but were worried how comparable the Renaissance would be, were very pleasantly surprised at how nice it was..it even looks a little like the Palomar...minus the price! Even though it is not new, they have done a beautiful renovation. the lobby is very chic and nice, great bar area and an excellent breakfast buffet. Our room was on the 17th floor overlooking dowtown and had the MOST COMFORTABLE BED I've ever splept on! The room was very nice and clean with new furnishings and I loved the extra vanity OUTSIDE the bath..great for 2 people. The only down side is it is not close to anything...you must drive to most restaurants and intertainment but being off the freeway was very convenient. Great little lunch spot down the street...Mama's Daughter's Cafe....a must!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: MrShowman
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the Renaissance Hotel; it had a great downtown view, nice lobby, terrific and pleasant staff. It had a fenced in parking lot. Bed was awesome. Next time Iâ€™m in Dallas I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte U
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the night of our wedding and it was wonderful. The staff was friendly and fantastic! I will definitely stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but noisy at times...”
Reviews.Author: Leslie0766
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights. Rooms were spacious and clean, we had 2 queens, had a nice sectional sofa as well. All rooms have fridges (we were told they did and ours did). Also, two sinks, one in the bathroom and one right outside. Nice for a family of 4. We did find that the hotel was pretty noisy throughout the night...doors shut loudly, heard next door alarm clock go off several times, people talking in the hallway, late at night, this may just be because of the age of the hotel. I would request room at the end of the hallways, though do to the design of the hotel, these are the smaller rooms. Work out facilities were nice and they offer free washer/dryer and detergent in a room off of the work-out area. Did not eat at any of the hotel's restaurants. Lobby was very pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could've stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: dtravelgirl007
Reviews.Content: We came in 1 day early before my conference to check out the Dallas sights. So, we stayed here because I'm a Marriott Rewards Gold Member. It was mid-July and it was so hot & humid. We loved the fact this place is air-conditioned...such a relief. The rooms were clean & we have a great view of Dowtown Dallas. The concierge room was well-stocked. The staff was friendly. Thoroughly enjoyed our breakfast! Would definitely stay here again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Texas”
Reviews.Author: kenneth b
Reviews.Content: This was my last stop on my Texas Portfolio day tour. The room was wonderful and the people in the club room were more then helpful. When you walk into the hotel you are greeted by some of the helpful people I've ever meet. The conference room we booked for our off campus intereviews was a great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: chgocutie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance from Sept 30 - Oct 2. I found the hotel to be in a good location, about 10 minutes outside of downtown right off of Stemmons Freeway. The staff were very professional and nice, except for one incident with breakfast, more of which I'll explain later. The amenities that were there were absolutely wonderful, and the rooftop pool is really nice, especially on a warm evening. What other reviewers have said about having to take the elevator to the 30th floor, then go down a hall and up two flights of stairs to get to the pool and fitness center, is absolutely correct - it's not that bad though. The view from my 21st floor room of the Dallas skyline was beyond breathtaking. Always request a city view whenever possible!!! The room was spacious, near the elevator, clean and for the most part, quiet. The only issue that I had was at breakfast. I received a coupon for a free breakfast, and wanted clarification on what was included in the "free breakfast". (Some hotels only offer cold items and cereal under the "free" breakfast.) The hostess had no idea as to what I was talking about, and after five awkward minutes one of the other servers finally came up and assisted us. Turns out everything was included. We were glad to hear that! All in all, I will be staying there again the next time I'm in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Still Going Strong.......”
Reviews.Author: Capeman123
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many years ago when I was a sales manager for my current company. I was never disappointed as the service level was always excellent. This weekend I came back for the Horns/OU game. The hotel was at 100% capacity which is the perfect storm for service levels to drop off as the staff is stretched. The Renaissance handled the customer load as well as OU handled the Horns. Great performance Renaissance.......

Reviews.Title: “Best in Texas”
Reviews.Author: smbolin
Reviews.Content: Three weeks ago I had the opportunity to stay at a hotel in Dallas, I choose Renaissance Dallas Hotel. Best choice I made. Location: Perfect, right off the highway and the toll way, stone throw from Downtown and 10 min to Galleria via the Toll way. View: OMG amazing, at night the lights on the skyline was soooo beautiful to look at, who needs to watch TV when one can enjoy Dallas skyline. Room: Clean, LARGE, updated, comfortable, smelled good, flat screen TV, modern furniture, wide hallways that are well lit and beautiful carpeting. It's the detail that they put into everything that impressed me. Food: Ate at the Concierge which was quite tasty. Concierge: Quite roomy, comfortable seats and staff were very friendly and accommodating. Elevator: never more than a 1 min. wait, always clean and smelled good. Looking forward to my next visit to Dallas and I will definitely be staying at Renaissance Dallas Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Service and Great Market Center Location”
Reviews.Author: BjB_11
Reviews.Content: The Renaissan Dallas Hotel is located close to the Dallas Market Center and provides wonderful service. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the room rate was the same as other lower quality hotels in the area. The bar and resturant served good food at a reasonable pce. I would reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: don h
Reviews.Content: I stay in approximately 180-200 hotels a year, What makes this hotel so special is they have everything in abundance; good people, good service, good facilities, good rooms, good food. They score a knockout! This is my favorite hotel in the United States.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations met and exceeded”
Reviews.Author: WooPigSooieFan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Dallas Hotel for 3 nights and found that the hotel met and exceeded all our expectations. Our check-in was efficient and friendly. We reserved the room using the incredible AAA rate which included the breakfast buffet in the restaurant, Asador. The choices were varied and all quite good. Our room on the 16th floor had a beautiful view of the downtown Dallas skyline. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were luxurious. The room had a 37" flat screen TV with lots of channels. A mini-fridge and a safe were available in the room. Coffe/tea was also available. The bathroom amenities included Aveda products. There were 2 sinks in the room--one in the bathroom and one outside the bathroom. We went to the roof to see the pool, whirlpool, and fitness center, but didn't have time to use them. It appeared that the pool was a lap pool. Parking is complimentary and there were lots of spaces available. There is a charge for valet parking. We knew that the hotel is about 20 miles from Cowboy Stadium, but we prefer to stay in this area rather than near the stadium. On a busy week-end with lots of sporting events going on, the hotel was busy, but we were always greeted with a smile by the employees. Marriott Rewards members who have access to the Club Lounge will be impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Solid, and nice touches too...”
Reviews.Author: youbake
Reviews.Content: We were in Dallas area on a recent pleasure trip thru the lower Mississippi Valley region and choose the Renaissance Dallas Hotel for our last couple of days before returning home. I didn't disappoint us. First impression was hard to beat, met @ front of the lobby and upon disclosure of our name, we were given room and keys and given a brief description of the property. We felt like the room was clean and comfy, facility was in good shape and lounge was cozy. Sure do wish Marriott would keep lounges open thru the weekend, this is always a major disappointment and this property is guilty of this issue. Also, Marriott should revisit the alchol policy and allow the OPEN BAR, vs. the honors system, which we very much dislike. Rooftop pool and small exercise room were o.k.. The neighborhood is rough and since we are not locals, we encountered a scary experience getting gas near the hotel coming back from the Ranger's game, beware... The key to our stay was a special weekend rate, very good value! Good view, good bed and room overall. Didn't like the bribe in the lounge on the computer to get guests to "enhance" the Tripadvisor rating, not playing fair.

Reviews.Title: “Somehow you know it's going to be great when you pull up to it!”
Reviews.Author: Vintage66
Reviews.Content: First time in a Renassaince property for a while. Doors opened and greeted when we pulled up....luggage & car dealt with smoothly. Directed to reception ( remodelled lobby has been done very nicley) and key cards in our hand very quickly.....bags brought up to the room promptly....all very slick. Room a great size and very clean.....all facilities you would expect including a fridge. Had breakfast on a couple of mornings...excellent Buffett choice & service was pretty steady. Location for us pretty ideal as we wanted to be able to drive to airport area reasonably quickly and downtown within a reasonable cab fare. This hotel seems to have some pretty decent deals and represents outstanding value. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “1 of the best hotels in the country”
Reviews.Author: olemiss2
Reviews.Content: number one place to stay in the metroplex, i love dallas and i love this hotel friendly service great time to shine

Reviews.Title: “Marriott - 1st place for us!!!”
Reviews.Author: french4us
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive...gorgeous lobby, not details missed. The front desk staff was friendly and so knowledgle - they made some great recommendations for us of places to eat and places to see. Kevin was the one we spoke with - he said best steak house is Texas-Nick & Sams...he wa so right! Our room was clean, comfy and the decor was so nice! We had a great view of the dallas city skyline! The food, drinks and service in the lobby restaurant were wonderful! Excellent Marriott Property!!! Close to alot of things to do...we will definatly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale, convenient & very reasonable!”
Reviews.Author: Ron B
Reviews.Content: I travel quite often, and I really enjoyed this hotel. The property is close to Love Field and in great shape and surprisingly inexpensive. From the Navigator who greets incoming guests to the housekeeping staff to the Concierge hostesses, all employees were enthusiastic and attentive. The room was modern and attractive with a very comfortable bed, large flat screen TV with AV inputs, a safe and a small refrigerator. Parking was thin the first night but easier the second night.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Average Decor”
Reviews.Author: NJ008
Reviews.Content: Nothing special. The location is not very convenient. The rooms are nice size, however decor is average. Overall it was average experience.

Reviews.Title: “Happy traveler”
Reviews.Author: BamaRich745
Reviews.Content: I like the way the people here greet you at the door when you walk in and how easy check-in is. They already have your keys ready. I like the self parking aspect of the property and it's accessibility to the DFW area. As a Marriott Platinum member, I always receive access to the lounge area which is great for breakfast and snacks in the evening. Many nights, I don't even go out for dinner. The people are great up in the lounge. Erin, Kristin, and all the folks are always so nice and friendly. The rooms are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Conference / Business Location”
Reviews.Author: stlyons84
Reviews.Content: We held our Texas Total Rewards Conference at this hotel last week and I was very pleased. The hotel was beautiful and the staff was most accommodating. The rooms were nice and clean and presented well to our guests. The conference food was good, but I was not that impressed with food or cocktails in the dining room. Taco Tuesday was definitely better than Monday night. The rooftop outdoor pool and hot tub was wonderful after travel and several long days either in chairs or on my feet. Free Wi-Fi in the business center and main lobby was all I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations are out of this World!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alan1231
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth time staying at the Renaissance and it only gets better and better. The staff is great and always great you through out the hotel. They are always asking if they can help in anyway. The restaurant and bar is excellent and has an extensive beer and wine list. I would highly recommend this hotel for any traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Internet Issues”
Reviews.Author: Summit4321
Reviews.Content: My one day quick stay would have been perfect had I not had issues with the internet. I was on business and was stranded by Wifi that simply would not work. I was transferred to tech support by the front desk and no one answered. After listening to 20 rings I just gave up, got drunk and ordered a wonderful room service meal, probably one of the best I've had. At the end of the day I missed working for 2-3 hours that evening, frustrating until I had a drink and the best roasted chicken meal! Would I return?..............only with a personal wifi hot spot!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest/Friendliest Hotel in DFW”
Reviews.Author: Lauren F
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveller, I have stayed at 100 Marriotts in the past 5 years. This is by far one of the best hotels in terms of friendly staff, clean rooms, great amenities and the overall ambience is amazing. I would definitely recommend anyone to stay here as it is perfect for family, friends, business or even solo. Definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “All confort!, great service”
Reviews.Author: jackiesamy
Reviews.Content: the hotel didnot charge for self parking, breakfast was around $18 buffet, the rooms super confortable, totatly equiped for business, coffee maker etc the bed was extermely confortable, I slept like a baby. is walking distance from market place and across the conention center market place and also a flea market. next to the expressways and 19 minutes from the dallas ft worth int'l airport, the traffic in afternoon was a little bad so we took 30 minutes to go back to the airport. we went to Galleria mall very big and they have an ice skating center inside the mall, awesome

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and Dated”
Reviews.Author: dressagequeenTX
Reviews.Content: Beware- the chic lobby tends to hide the age of this hotel. Upon entering we thought that it would be a nice and comfortable place to rest. Even the room seemed nice at first glance. However the shower stayed backed up, paint is chipping from the door frames, and the carpet had some staining. The elevator made some weird noises while on our way to the 20th floor and that was slightly disconcerting. Also the walls are FAR from sound proof. You could easily hear the doors slamming and housekeeping talking loudly in the halls. I doubt I'll stay here again. I'd rather stay in a Holiday Inn Express.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, great restaurant, but noisy music playing everywhere.”
Reviews.Author: travelrlynn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance in Dallas over Labor Day weekend for a convention that was held in the Hilton Anatole across the street (they were booked solid). Nice hotel, very pleasant staff. Rooms were nothing extraordinary, but liked the fact that there was a sink/vanity in the bath and in the hall adjoining the bath. Very helpful as we were 2 women sharing the suite. Up on the top level was the swimming pool, smallish, and a little scary up so high if you have a fear of heights. Washer and dryer on that level also, as well as fitness room. The best thing at the hotel was the restaurant, Asador, on the main level, featuring many locally produced foods. Food was reasonably priced and it was never too crowded. Breakfast was a buffet, but a little pricey at $18.95. I am a small eater, so I don't think I'd ever eat that much breakfast! My only beef with the hotel is the music playing EVERYWHERE. In the lobby, in the restaurant, outside the building, in all the main hallways. And it is loud. Loud enough that it is hard to carry on a conversation. Staff said they had no means to lower the volume. Even though we didn't spend an inordinate amount of time there as our convention was across the street, it became like a form of torture when we were there. Next year we will book early with the Anatole and run across to the Renaissance for meals!

Reviews.Title: “See you next year!”
Reviews.Author: muktownmomma
Reviews.Content: Great room, exceptional staff and the updated "organic" restaurant is simply amazing! the seating areas around the hotel give opportunities for conversations without having to be in a "bar". Thank you - see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in town”
Reviews.Author: billsing97
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Dallas Hotel is a first class property with great service and a wonderful restaurant. This is my new "go-to" place in Dallas. Great location, great bar, great lounge and these all add up to a great stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Average Renaissance hotel”
Reviews.Author: M30001
Reviews.Content: Stayed in club level king room. Size of room was fine but just average. Quality was ok overall but not quite consistent with other renaissances (some wallpaper peeling from the walls at edges, decorations/furnishings were plain). Lounge was not open over weekend, which was a minus. Location is just ok - there is nothing around it and it's not near the hot spots in uptown. Overall a fine stay, but not quite what you might expect from a renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: re3ver
Reviews.Content: "Friendly staff, clean rooms, quick room service, roof top pool with plenty of towels and chairs, free parking, what more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “I've been here a dozen times before, and I'm looking forward to the next dozen”
Reviews.Author: John G
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a quite a few Marriott properties over the years (I stay about 75 nights a year), and this is one of my favorite places to stay. While Dallas is hot this time of year, the rooftop pool is a nice oasis to relax. The rooms are updated, and the staff is always willing to accomodate me and are genuinely supurb. It's right of the freeway, so it's easy to get just about anywhere. If you're looking for a sleek, modern hotel, for business travelers, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel has just gotten better”
Reviews.Author: TallSasha
Reviews.Content: I'm in Dallas monthly on business and have been staying at this hotel for over 3 years. They recently renovated the main areas and restaurant/bar for the Super bowl last year and they did a great job, (although you will see an increase in the rates you used to pay in the past). Previously, I avoided their restaurant and opted for the taxi to dinner option. But since their renovation, their new menu is great. They stick with as much organic and local farmers as possible. Even though I get breakfast free in the Concierge club, I opted for paying for the wild boar breakfast tacos (YUM) and the oatmeal waffle. If you have access, the concierge club has also certainly stepped up their food offerings in the evening, sticking with a "theme" and offering heavier options if you wanted to skip dinner. Kristen is so friendly and helpful, that I feel like I'm "home with friends" when I'm in town. Also, I enjoy this club room most because you have the option of ordering "room service" delivered to the club room to enjoy (as opposed to eating alone in your room). More Marriott's should consider this. The rooms have a modern feel to them and like others have commented, a higher room offers a nice view. The thread count on the sheets is heavenly and the curtains are great at keeping the room as dark as you need. The one challenge is that your cell phone may not work for long in certain rooms before you lose the call. If you are patient, you will sometimes find the exact spot you need to stand/sit in to not lose the call, or it may not be an issue. Also, although I'm not a gym person, I do like to take walks. Outside, next to the hotel is a HUGE parking lot that stretches multiple city blocks if you wanted to get out (and enjoy the 100+ degrees). Also, if you are an elite member, they have the express check in when you arrive so I do not have to go to the front desk. My key is waiting for me at the door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, we loved the Renaissance Club and Asador restaraunt!”
Reviews.Author: johnoksu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from August 24 - 28. I brought our 18 month son for a short vacation while my wife was at a conference. The staff have been wonderful, especially the staff in the Concierge Lounge (Renaissance Club). The room is clean, spacious, and chic. We have eaten breakfast and dinners at the Asador, and the food and atmosphere has been wonderful! The rooftop pool is great for my son, and the fitness center looks nice (haven't used it). I would highly recommend this hotel. We'll definitely be back! Great job Marriott!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Jeff L
Reviews.Content: This hotel is phenomenal, The accomodations are fantastic - very clean and well maintained. The staff is efficient, professional, and friendly. They make you feel like you are part of the family. The next time I'm in Dallas I will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great personal service”
Reviews.Author: Rita p
Reviews.Content: I'm a senior female. The staff was great from the time I got out of the car to the time I left. They handled my baggage and referenced me by name each time I approached the front desk. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, great everything”
Reviews.Author: inmadridsoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance Dallas Hotel during a business trip. From check in to to check out, service was outstanding. Rooms were clean, spacious and cold (better be in the Dallas heat). Concierege lounge was excellent, didnt have to go out for breakfast or dinner with light food provided. Next trip tp the big D, staying here.

Reviews.Title: “â€œPerfect location, amazing building and wonderful staffâ€�”
Reviews.Author: Weston S
Reviews.Content: It was like coming home (only better as I did not have to do the dishes) after a long day at the office. The room was perfection and the bed made me hit the snooze alarm once or twice, truth be told. I have to say one of the nicest items about this hotel is the staff. You can find a lovely bed almost anywhere, but finding a staff that greets you with a friendly demeanor, no matter what time of day is a rarity. The Concierge lounge is well equipped for all your needs and the restaurant and bar have great food and beverage choices as well

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing! Great staff, restaurant, and service. Perfect location, as it is in a very centralized spot. No need to leave the hotel at all. Rooftop pool was soooo much fun!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite stops...!”
Reviews.Author: dsvols
Reviews.Content: There's nothing I don't like about this hotel. Great staff, well appointed rooms, excellent dining and the location is ideal. The staff is always accommodating. I spend more than 100 nights per year on the road and this property is in my top 10!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Service in the business”
Reviews.Author: John E
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a 10 day stay and got one of the smallest rooms they have. When I brought it to the attention of the front desk, they absolutely went out of their way to make my wife and I, not only happy but ecstatic. I spend at least 10 nights a month in a hotel (almost exclusively marriott properties) and am always treated well, but this trip we were treated like family. The staff is to a person - 5 STAR. The hotel itself is very conveniently located to everything in the Dallas area, within about 10 minutes or less. If you want a perfect stay, this is the only place in Dallas to go. John Elkins

Reviews.Title: “Now what I expected as a frequent Marriott customer”
Reviews.Author: Greg W
Reviews.Content: The building exterior looks great, the king rooms on the end of the building are very small. Carpet and decor are outdated in rooms. Very few sleeping pillows on the bed. If you stay here ask for the side with the view, the side with no view has a train running every 4 hours. Pool is very small and not much furniture outside, only 3'9" deep. Gym is very limited. Check in and front desk staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Still keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: Calli S
Reviews.Content: We have made the Renaissance our home for every market trip for the last 16 years or so. We never gave up on it and Tim Sullivan continued to make it special. We were excited when he showed us the new plan and now that the renovation is complete the hotel excels. We love the new dining area, the ambience when you enter and all the special corners where you can sit and relax is extremely special for a hotel that is mostly business. It is professionaly run, the conscierge and bell boys do an excellent job. If you need to be in the World Trade Area this is an excellent choice. We keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: Cornelius P
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has been Great thus far. The staff has been tremndous with meet and greet. The hospitality has been a 5 STAR mentality. This Hotel really exemplfy all the true values that Marriott stands for. I would definantly recommend this Hotel to others to come and stay during their visit in the Dallas area. I flew into Love airport and this place is perfect location. Once again appreciate the service and I hope they continue to provide a service of excellence.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful renovations !! Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: TAGSMOTHER
Reviews.Content: All the changes are absolutely beautiful. very beautiful and modern. Restaurant lovely but I do miss T Bones !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Business traveler”
Reviews.Author: Gary M
Reviews.Content: I travel over 125 nights per year and am happy to stay about 20 of those nights at the Renaissance in Dallas. From the efficient check in to the great large rooms to the fantastic gym, my needs are met with high efficiency and little fan fare. Attentive service and a bit of luxury to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Dallas to rest, revitalize, and renew....”
Reviews.Author: JoeBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is conveniently located, has a terrific view of the city, and gets my top marks for all the things I expect as 'givens' for a first class hotel - clean, modern design, extensive excercise area, good sized lap pool, plenty of towels, large HD-TV. I travel extensively throughout the year (> 250 room-nights) and place the Renaissance Dallas in the top 5 places I have stayed in the past year. The icing on the cake here is the friendly staff, all of whom go the extra mile to make a traveler feel welcome and a valued part of the hotel's unique energy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Larry3750
Reviews.Content: The difference between hotels is the service level of the staff. At the Renaissance Dallas Texas you are greated with a smile and a welcoming attitude. I spend fasr too many nights on the road, so when I find a hotel that makes me feel a part of the family, I come back. The Renaissane is my home away from home inDallas

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: Guest202020
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum member, I have stayed in many locations, but this Marriott by far has the best staff and customer service. Greeting you at the front door is Big John - with a big smile on, a friendly handshake and warm welcome back to Stephen with my keys ready to go instead of waiting in line at the desk all the way to my favorite spot - the lounge where Kristen and Erin make you feel right at home and welcome. The room service menu could have a wider selection for those that visit quite often. Just minutes outside downtown and with the customer service experience, the hotel makes for a very good option

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, great view of Dallas skyline”
Reviews.Author: Judy0145
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The staff was outstanding and welcoming from the moment we registered and more than willing to help us with any questions we had, etc. The rooms are lovely, clean, updated decor, the beds quite comfortable, and hallways quiet. We had a wonderful view of the Dallas skyline at night and it added to the overall ambience. The only negative is the location is not convenient for walking to restaurants and attractions. You must rely on a car or cab to get most places. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was very classy”
Reviews.Author: macbuzz2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and it was across from the convention center. The interior was beautiful and the room was clean, beds comfortable. If I had to say anything that could be better, it would be the size of the bathroom. The bathroom seemed small and not as nice as the rest of the room but clean. I would stay again and tell my friends to stay as well.

Reviews.Title: “Why this hotel is my home in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: BobButler
Reviews.Content: I travel to Dallas frequently for business and stayed in many hotels in and around downtown before I discovered the Renaissance. Here are the reasons this is my favorite place to stay: - Exceptional quality: The lobby and restaurant were recently renovated and are beautiful. - Comfortable rooms: The bed is excellent, as is the furniture in the rooms. When I'm working I can kick back in the lounge chair with my laptop and get tons of work done. The decor is nice, great in-room coffee and the building is insulated so you don't hear any traffic noise. You feel like you are at home, not in a hotel. - Bathrooms are exceptionally clean and elegant. Great towels and salon grade bath products. - Love the gym: It's on the roof level. After a morning workout I love going outside to catch the Dallas skyline in the morning. - Concierge Room: It has a great breakfast, great staff and is a very comfortable spot if you need to have a small meeting on the road. - Excellent staff: I feel like they knew me the second time I showed up! Everyone is very attentive and friendly. - Love the restaurant: It's farm to table style. Everything is fresh and delicious. If you appreciate eating excellent food sourced locally, you'll appreciate the food here. - Great value: it's competitive with all the hotels near downtown and you get so much more. - Easy parking: You can self park or valet. No downtown traffic or tight garages. If you are looking for top tier hotel near downtown Dallas, you can't go wrong with this one. I've probably spent 50 nights hear and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Staycation Destination”
Reviews.Author: EAPDallas
Reviews.Content: We needed to escape from reality but could not afford to go very far. This hotel is literally five minutes from home, but it has a pool on the roof, and we do not! So, we went for the pool: to relax, catch a few rays, read a book and pretend we were in some other location for 24 hours. We checked in early and were given a room on the 30th floor as we had requested. The room was spacious, clean, classy and very comfortable. The only complaint we have is that the AC did not seem to cool at the level to which it was set during the middle of the night. This warmed things up a bit. Nice big bathroom. Two sinks, one separate from the bathroom. Large shower/tub and good water pressure. Very clean. Lovely thick towels and plenty of them. Now on to the pool: This is a rectangular 3 foot deep pool approximately 20 X 40 feet. It is on the outside on the very top of the building. You must get to the pool area by going up a flight of stairs from the 30th floor and cutting through the very nice, very well air-conditioned exercise room. We were not there to exercise. We ordered room service to be delivered poolside. The food was good, service was fast, and they really did a nice job with napkins, ice buckets, arranging the umbrella, etc. Life was good until about 3:30PM. Management came around to the handful of guests who were basking like us and informed us that the pool was being shut down and we all had to leave the pool area due to "maintenance issues". Now, since we had gone there specifically for this pool, that did not make us too happy. We went down to the front desk to check out. There we were met by staff members who offered to drive us to the Marriott pool down the street. We would have taken them up on that, but the Marriott down the street is not a Marriott I want to spend any time in whatsover. The front desk, who knew we were there to use the pool (and that it was our anniversary) were most understanding. They gave us our room for less than half price and gave us a deal to stay another night along with a free in-room movie. They promised that the pool would be repaired by the next morning, and in fact, it was. We really enjoyed the bar at Asador and we actually ate dinner in the hotel at Asador both nights. It was very pleasant, relaxing, and the service was excellent. Asador can cook a really decent steak. All of the servers at the bar and in the restaurant knew our name and treated us like we were regulars. I was surprised at this level of attention. We did enjoy the complimentary breakfast both mornings as well, and we were not disappointed. Overall, it was a great staycation destination. We will go back when necessary to get away from our children.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Club Lounge!”
Reviews.Author: Beve315
Reviews.Content: Kristen, Courtney & Katty make being away from home as good as it gets. They are a fun loving group and awlays meet you with a warm welcome. Kristen has quite a following. You can dine in the Lounge instead of going to the niosy restaurant and the drinksare the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel remodel”
Reviews.Author: buckeyeflyer
Reviews.Content: Awesome remodel, conceriege lounge food and staff are take it to the next level. They go out of their way to make your stay so enjoyable and relaxing. Main restauant and bar are brand new and very eclectic. Great staff throughout the hotel. Always look forward to my stays here.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Kenard
Reviews.Content: As a road warrior, it's tough enough being away from home every week. At the Renaissance Dallas Hotel the staff make you feel right at home. I stay here every week I'm in town. The hospitality is outstanding and you can't find a better group of people that care about their customers. For you Marriott elite members, don't forget to visit the lounge and relax with friends after a long day at the office. Keep up the great work everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service as usual...”
Reviews.Author: jornst1
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Dallas Hotel is by far my favorite place to stay during my business travels to the Dallas area. Everyone here is professional and accommodating in every way possible. I could not ask for a better stay than what i've experienced at the Renaissance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: KMcAslan
Reviews.Content: Excellent business hotel and prime location in Dallas. Staff and accomodations were outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “This is my choice hotel while in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: HepCA
Reviews.Content: On the average, I travel three weeks out of every month. I stayed at this hotel for the first time. I was pleasantly surprised to be greeted personally at the door by a welcome associate. He quickly checked to obtain my keys and check-in without the need to proceed the check counter. At no fault of their's my reservation had not been complete. the check in staff were extremely courteous, professional and helpful in getting my room quickly. My room was spacious, very nicely furnished with a beautiful view. Not often do I feel like I am in my own home versus sitting in a hotel room. I enjoyed a excellent dinner in the restaurant. The Club lounge has several flat screens and computer terminals. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I will definitely be staying at this hotel, when I return to Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Great start to a perfect week!”
Reviews.Author: 1saks
Reviews.Content: After completing the 4 hour drive from Houston it was wonderful to be greeted at the door by our own personal welcome associate. They had our keys and check-in info all ready at a lobby desk...no waiting in a check-in line. They greeted us by name and were extremely courteous and professional. The hotel is beautiful and centrally located for all of our business and shopping needs. We enjoyed prompt room service and a comfortable nights sleep before starting our tour of the city! All of the staff that we encountered were friendly and helpful. Would definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel when in Dallas for Downtown Business”
Reviews.Author: Darcy111
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, always friendly and helpful staff. Easy access to downtown. I always stay here when in Dallas and have never been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Richgray68
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance never fails to amaze me. The staff from the front desk, maid service, to the premier lounge were very friendly and went out of their way to make me feel at home and to be accommodating. I plan on staying at the Renaissance next time I am in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: fatespawn
Reviews.Content: I've been staying in this property for 5 years. The last 3 years I have been a very regular customer. The staff is courteous and accommodating. They recently accomplished a nice remodel of their lobby. The restaurant changed the menu significantly, and they are doing a good job of continually changing the menu to meet customers desires. They have some work to do, but it's a good start on their menu. Nice property. Enjoy the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in great location for downtown business”
Reviews.Author: Reelove
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and the location, but the staff is truly outstanding. Kristen and Erin in the concierge lounge truly make you feel at home and are extremely helpful with navigation in the area. John the bellman is always smiling and ready to help also.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely love the Renaissance Dallas hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Lido1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Dallas from June 30 to July 7, for 7 nights. Wow ! What an amazing experience the whole stay was !
