Even better than my first time about a year ago when the hotel was undergoing renovations. I arrived at the hotel early, around 8am, as I drove from Philadelphia and was exhausted from the long drive. Of course I didn`t expect for my room to be ready that early, despite the fact that I`m a Marriott Platinum member, but decided to take the chance nonetheless and see if they had any rooms available so I could go to sleep. As soon as I walked up to the front desk both ladies who were working immediately dropped what they were doing and greeted me with a warm, genuine smile. Now as we all know on many occassions that doesn`t happen anymore. In many hotels, front desk personnel not only don`t greet you with a big smile but they don`t even get their eyes off the computers and acknowledge you`re even there ! I dealt with Melissa, who was the front desk supervisor. Not only did she check me in at 8am with no hassle but she also upgraded me to one of their lovely corner one bedroom suites ! She welcomed me back to their property by my last name and wished me a pleasant stay. In the meantime, from bell man to floor attendants to valet, everyone was so nice and always ready to help. Half the time I had breakfast at their club lounge which is stocked with everything you need for a great start and half the time at their lobby restaurant named Asador by Chef Dean Max, which was equally good, especially the made-to-order omelettes and all the different varieties of fresh fruit. I also had dinner there one evening. All the ingredients they use for breakfast, lunch and dinner are as fresh as you can get and you can tell the difference, believe me. Everyone working the club lounge was so polite and accomodating also but Kathy Loomis, Kamu Patel and Tambry really stand out. They are professional but at the same time have fun and you can tell they sincerely love what they do. My suite was beautiful, with ample room, amazingly comfortable bed with lots of pillows, two large flat screen HDTVs and a full sofa bed in the living room for another guest. Internet is wired and wireless and it`s free for Gold and Platinum members ! Lastly, their pool is located on the 31st floor and it`s awesome with breathtaking views of the downtown Dallas skyline ! Gym is pretty decent with free weights, machines and water and fresh fruit to keep you hydrated and it`s right next to the swimming pool on the top floor. Fourth of July was great from the rooftop swimming pool as we saw the fireworks lighten up the city. When you`re in Dallas you should definitely try to stay at the Renaissance. If the same employees I talked to -and there were lots of them- are still working there, trust me, they will not let you down ! Tips. Have dinner at Asador. The food is exceptional ! Try to visit the Dallas and the Kimball Museum of Art in Fort Worth. They are both world-class. Join Marriott Rewards at front desk, as points add up fast ! I always try to tip the person cleaning my room and the club lounge attendant. You don`t have to but they will truly appreciate it. They are such good workers.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: KESmithAustin
Reviews.Content: Long trip with several delays at the airport so was frustrated upon arrival to the hotel. From the moment we walked in the door it was hard to stay in a negative mood. Check in was quick and easy with a very delightful young woman who greeted us with a smile. We immediately went up to the pool to catch some sun. Loved the restaurant and all the renovations that took place over the last year. The rooms are spacious with flat screen tvs, comfortable beds, great view of downtown, and great location. The CLUB LOUNGE was by far the best of any that I have ever been in. Erin was there to great me with a smile and Kristen remembered my name and exactly what type of drink that I wanted. Asked them for some recommendations for restaurants and they send us to several good ones. These two girls are definitely the highlight of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: lexinator
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Renaissance Hotel in Dallas for years. I've tried others but always come back to the Renaissance for their value, service, and location. Recently updated rooms, gym, and concierge level have brought the property to an even higher level. The staff is extremely helpful. A new and updated restaurant and bar area provide an outstanding selection of food. Overall, outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good has gotten better”
Reviews.Author: sixcOntinents_11
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance has been one of my favorite business hotels for years due to large, comfortable rooms, distinctive style and outstanding customer service. The recent re-design of the lobby and restaurant areas is striking. The hotel has now added a concierge lounge that is big enough to accommodate the morning rush. My king bed room was large enough to also include a plush, comfortable lounge chair in one corner as well as a sofa under the window and a large desk with plenty of work space. Ask for a room on a high floor with an even number to be wowed by a great view of downtown Dallas. Beyond the physical attributes, the staff at the Renaissance Dallas continues to be top-notch, responding at any special requests. A very nice touch is being greeted as you enter by a lobby concierge who can check guests in remotely without the need to stand in line at the front desk. The concierge lounge staff is friendly, helpful and seems always wiling to extend the deadlines just a little for breakfast or evening snacks. I have stayed in literally dozens of Dallas area hotels and this is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: Caprice2000
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel since 5/2/2011 on Sunday thru Thursday nights every week for a long term business assignment. The hotel is really great. The lobby is clean and large and open to the restaurant and bar. The rooms are spacious and every one of them has a small fridge that you can use if you have leftovers for dinner or want to stop at a convenience store to stock up on a few things. The rooms are clean with lots of outlets and wireless so you can move around the room and work where you are most comfortable. And the beds are awesome. The mattresses are firm but the bedding is soft and comfy. You can request feather or foam pillows to customize your bed for a great night sleep. Each room has an individual thermostat so you can set the temperature for sleeping or working to your individual preference. The workout room is small but functional and they have made the most of the space. I would like to see the equipment updated so that each of them has the personal TV that I have seen at other Marriott properties. The staff has been nothing but courteous and friendly. The few times that I have needed additional service they have been very accommodating. I leave a bag at the front desk with extra shoes, exercise equipment and toiletries on Thursdays each week. Often, when I check in on Sunday nights they have my bag right there ready for me. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Raybo1
Reviews.Content: My 3 day business stay at the Rennaissance hotel Dallas was fantastic. The hotel has been recently renovated and I felt the upgrades were right on the money, especially the new restaurant. Furthermore, the hotel staff was fantastic, especially Katthy Loomis who works in the concierge lounge on the 27th floor. The concierge lounge offered delicious appetizers in the evening and a full breakfast in the morning on the weekdays. Thank you again for a wonderful stay and I always feel confident in the Marriott Brand name. Ray Rabano

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Renovation and Service”
Reviews.Author: CJLatlanta
Reviews.Content: The Dallas Renaissance has undergone a fantastic renovation over the last year and the rooms and bathrooms are very nice and comfortable. Large flat screen, HDTV's with high definition programming make it even better! Aveda products in the bathroom are a plus as well. The beds are firm but comfortable with nice linens and pillows. There's even a nice seating area in the rooms with two queen beds. The location is within an easy walk to the Dallas Market center and great restaurants and shopping are a quick cab ride away. The food in the hotel was also very good in the newly renovated restaurant. The staff is very friendly and attentive and are helpful with any request. Their willingness to assist with anything from an extra blanket to arranging transportation is a great asset to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It's the best hotel and has the greatest staff in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: NormNeece
Reviews.Content: I stayed off and on (mostly on) at this hotel from March 2010 until June 2011. It was a very enjoyable experience and I highly recommend it! The staff from check-in, the maids, the concierge staff, and management were top notch. It definately felt like my other home!! The hotel itself is very nice, clean and well appointed! I highly recommend if your in Dallas to stay at this property!

Reviews.Title: “They Care!”
Reviews.Author: stogeytc
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay after a long hard day. The folks here really care and go above and beyond in ensuring the customer is well attended - with courtesy and promptness. The gals in the club lounge are extremely welcoming, attentive and pure service professionals. Erin in the lounge remembers guest's names if they have been there at least once - she and her co-hearts put smiles on everyone's faces. What a nice atmosphere with an accomodating work ethic - down to the cookies and milk late at night, The recently renovated hotel is upscale with a modernism that is both warm and welcoming - matching the attitude of the staff. The fare at the restaurant is an adventure for the taste buds with a creative local flare that is unmatched. The combination of bar and restuarant area makes for a great gathering place that breams with atmoshphere and many special house elixirs to accompany the night. I have stayed in many hotels around the world and in Dallas and this places would be my number one place to stay - if only I could carry the hotel with me to all my destinations. Its the people, the place and the attitude that'll keep me coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great property and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: kennif65
Reviews.Content: I stay at this propery whenever I am in Dallas! Newly remodeled and upscale. Helpful staff and well appointed rooms (With Fridge). Great pool on the 30th floor and great views.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: luvNY94
Reviews.Content: Right from the start, the valet attendant allowed us to leave our car parked right in front of the entryway so we can check in. And then, Kevin from the front desk was waiting for the next guest, which happened to be us. He walked us over to his position, and amidst casual conversation, quickly checked us in and gave us a room on the 19th floor, which had a great view! The room itself was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The pillows were lumpy, according to my husband, while I thought that they were too soft. It was a quick fix, though, as there were 3 other pillows. There was a separate washroom, in addition to the one complete bathroom (toilet, sink, bathtub). We stayed for 2 nights, and couldn't have been happier with our choice. (We did get this room with a corporate group rate, which was a reasonable price, but we're not sure how much it'd normally cost.)

Reviews.Title: “Best place”
Reviews.Author: Markloitz
Reviews.Content: Guest service is fantastic. Rooms are roomy and always clean!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: tambaru
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 days. Got in late, the restaurant was still open and the staff could not have been nicer. As I am on the road every week, I can say with confidence that this hotel is one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel; questionable location”
Reviews.Author: careofme
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel; seems like they updated the insides recently under a frame of an older "model". Location was not very conveniento to many attractions. Pool was small, old and fitness equipment outdated. Nevertheless, slept well and service was relatively good with a nice restaurant bar/restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Place to Stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: jeffveld
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, great location, good food and friendly staff especcially Kristen in the concierge lounge. She always takes good care of us. Also need to mention Erin who always makes us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: tjarvas
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel regularly and I am continually pleased by it's staff's friendliness and professionalism. There are many choices in Dallas and the Renaissance will always be mine!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for business stay”
Reviews.Author: Richison
Reviews.Content: I travel to Dallas for business on a regular basis, and prefer to stay at this hotel. It is clean and has plenty of amenities. The staff are also what keeps me coming back. Erin in the concierge lounge is always there to greet me with a smile and the rest of the staff are always friendly as well.

Reviews.Title: “I stay here for business all the time”
Reviews.Author: dpeim
Reviews.Content: The staff is very accomodating and take excellent care of my needs and requests. Erin (the manager) always knows when I am returning and makes sure my stay is good.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Dallas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wienerdogfan
Reviews.Content: Work brings me to Dallas frequently. I have stayed at many area hotels. The Renissance is my favorite by far. The rooms , which have been recently redone, are always clean and are very comfortable. The staff is always friendly and polite. I really appreciate the staff up in the lounge. Always greet me and make sure that all is well. The restaurant in the lobby has recently changed from a Steakhouse to a new age Mexican theme...I loved the steaks they had, so I was very hesitant to TTY he new place. But I am glad I did. They still have steaks, just different style. The other food is quality as well. I think they tweak the menu every few days, which makes it nice that it's not the same stuff day after day. When you find yourself in Dallas, I recommend ths hotel before any others.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - great views of the city, awesome pool and beautiful interior”
Reviews.Author: ajordancpa
Reviews.Content: Renaissance is a very nice hotel with great support staff. I have the luxury of being a gold member in the Marriott's reward program. I am really treated like royalty when I am here. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classic elegance with Modern Amenities”
Reviews.Author: chandler760
Reviews.Content: I travel to Dallas often on business and whenever possible, I like to stay at the Renaissance Dallas Hotel. First of all, the location is great. Less than 10 minutes from Downtown and the airport and most of my clients. Rooms on the city side have a great view of the Dallas city skyline. Freeway close to lots of nice restaurants and local landmarks like the American Airlines center where the Mavericks play. The rooms are clean and comfortable. Each one has an HD flat-screen TV with lots of inputs up front for video, hdmi, computer and Ethernet. Lots of TV channels to choose from including several ESPNs and HBO and HBO Family. Beds are very comfortable with lots of pillows to choose from. Rooms have a small fridge and safe and desk for working. LOTS of outlets by the bed and at the desk for your chargers, computers, etc. , which is great if you are a business traveler with lots of devices. Bathrooms have plenty of hot water and lots of towels. Lighting is good for the morning prep in front of the mirror. The only area that falls short is the wireless internet. The signal and bandwidth are usually not good enough to support a video chat on my computer and while browsing, pages are often slow to load. The food in the restaurant is really good. Lots of fresh grilled ingredients and a good variety. Menu items range from about $10 for a brisket sandwich up to $40 for the cowboy steak with most items being between $10 and $20. They smoke and grill many of the items and the taste of the food is really good. Breakfast buffet is also very good with lots of fruit choices and well prepared eggs, little potatoes, bacon and sausage. They also have a breakfast menu for prepared dishes if you want to skip the buffet. Marriott Elite members will enjoy great skyline views in the Club Lounge with complementary hors d'oeuvres and dessert items and non-alcoholic beverages in the evening. Alcoholic Beverages including wine, beer and mixed drinks can be purchased. Hotel staff are pleasant and helpful and willing to do what it takes to resolve anything that has come up. Facilities includes a nice sized pool and spa up on the foof of this 30 story building with a great view of the sky and stars. Fitness Center appears to have everything you would expect and maybe a little bit more.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: crndog10
Reviews.Content: The renovations at the Renaissance make this hotel an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility/weird menu”
Reviews.Author: ivauir
Reviews.Content: I stay here almost every week. The staff does a great job, the menu doesn't have enough choices that I would describe as "food". Does anyone really find the picked vegetables appetizing?

Reviews.Title: “I love the eclectic choices in the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: bob7855711
Reviews.Content: This is our third business stay at the hotel. We look forward to to because of the great restaurant with its eclectic menu. We also enjoy the lounge. We stay at Marriott properties exclusively, and this is definitely one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: LAPeyton
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at "my home away from home" for 7 months. Being away from home is tough but the folks at the Renaissance have been awesome. The staff in all areas make me feel at home and provide great customer service. For business travelers the available services are useful. The only area I could see improved is the addition of a more "casual friendly" restaurant with more choices. Their restaurant is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel that takes care of travelers in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lawlessc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the "football" Renaissance over a dozen times in the last six months and have been very satisfied. The hotel is in a location that is very convenient for downtown Dallas, has ample free parking as well as all the necessary amenities a business traveller needs. The restaurant is fine, concierge lounge is among the best of the Marriots I have stayed at and the staff overall are very accomodating. While I'm not a big user of the gym/pool facilities they have a good selection of workout equipment and a very cool pool located on the rooftop.

Reviews.Title: “Business vacation”
Reviews.Author: RLMoore04
Reviews.Content: Although I was at this hotel during a business trip, it was like a mini-vacation. The outdoor pool and deck on the roof of this hotel are perfect for getting some relaxation in after work. The staff are courteous and the room is comfortable. This is a great stay if you're in the Dallas area. It's easy access to the Freeway and a quick cab ride to downtown or uptown.

Reviews.Title: “Always A Superior Experience”
Reviews.Author: bucket46
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel weekly - 3 or 4 nights per week. The hotel offers me an excpetional home-away-from home. The staff is truly exceptional - caring, considerate and accomodating. The Renaissance Club is the perfect place to unwind and relax. The rooms are clean, modern and very comfortable. The Dallas Renaissance is absolutely excellent! Best staff in any hotel I have ever used.

Reviews.Title: “My Home in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: alvarezenriqueg
Reviews.Content: There is no place like Home and the Renaissance is my Home in Dallas. The people and management makes this place the best. Rooms, Lobby, Restaurant, and Health Club are all excellent and updated. The Hotel is located 15 minutes from downtown Dallas with alternate routes to avoid traffic if needed. I have a great time week after week after week.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: eedow460
Reviews.Content: Great view of downtown Dallas from guest room. Concierge very helpful in offering dining suggestions...also, best Club Lounge ever with the friendliest staff! Loved the roof top pool! You have to try the brisket sandwich & their signature margarita.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of embedded small good services. Great time!”
Reviews.Author: medinalucas
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Parking is free - Vending machines available in every floor - Fitness room is available for you not matter number of days staying or your "Rewards" level - Mini-fridge available in the room without things to sell you, but empty and you can fill it with wherever you want to eat/drink. - Landromat available for free use. Cons: - Internet access is a little expensive though - A little bit noise on connecting rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great, Solid Hotel, Location not that great”
Reviews.Author: EndyBOSTON
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance in Dallas is a great luxury hotel. It's located outside of Dallas, just off the highway. The location is not that great because there are no places to eat nearby at a walkable distance, or any public transportaiton. With that said, you will need a car to get around. No parking fees, so that is a plus. The restaurant on site is awesome, I recommend the Flatiron Steak with fried yuca strips. There is a decent roof top pool, not that big though. The view of the Dallas skyline at night is great.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at a great price.”
Reviews.Author: mishimum
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. Driving up the view of the building strikes you first. The lobby is gorgeous and the staff was friendly. The room is amazing and the view was nice. A little bit farther from downtown than I thought but West End definatly within minutes. The bed was amazingly comfortable. As soon as I hit the sheets I fell asleep. I would however be wary of the internet service. They have wifi but it cost $15.83 after taxes and it is not every fast. I am used to cable but this is more DSL speed. Just didn't seem worth paying that much for 24hours of wifi. Loving the in room check out too. I would definatly recomend this hotel to someone. For the price of the night it is more than worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel lobby and restaurant renovations are fantastic”
Reviews.Author: pemsinc
Reviews.Content: I was pleasently surprised to find the Renaissance Dallas Hotel finished out in such a beautiful manner. The new restaurant and menu with smoked items and new wines was excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends/family and other business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amorace
Reviews.Content: Great locaion, and everything was very nice at this hotel. Great View from the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Renovation, Service Wasn't Consistent”
Reviews.Author: theseacret
Reviews.Content: The hotel appeared to still be under renovation in the lobby. The rooms were tastefully decorated and my room had huge windows facing downtown, the only downsize was that the room was small. The internet was down the entire time I was there, they ran out of desserts from room service by 10pm. They also don't have a shuttle from the airport, which kind of stinks. All in all ,a good hotel but I expect a little more from this brand.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: AGall0
Reviews.Content: very spacious and clean rooms, good sleep quality and great hotel services and venue overall. it is just 5min drive from city center and has a nice cowboys warehouse just in front of the hotel, if you want to look for real boots and hats :-) the staff was incredibly helpfull and eager to find a room for me at last minute. i will surely visit it again in future!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel next door to Dallas Market Hall”
Reviews.Author: zihuatcat
Reviews.Content: I live in Dallas but stayed overnight at this hotel one night with a friend in town for a dog show next door at Market Hall. If you have a convention or event there, this hotel is perfect because it shares a parking lot and you can just walk across the lot. They also were offering very discounted rates for the dog show. The hotel room itself looked like it had been recently renovated with new furniture and carpet. Everything was clean. The main hotel floor was undergoing complete renovation so the main restaurant was closed. We ate in the 2nd floor restaurant and it was surprisingly very good. I had a steak and my friend had salmon, both very well-cooked and tasty. My only real complaint about the hotel is that the walls are very thin. At one point while my friend and I were talking, she laughed loudly and our neighbors banged on the wall telling us to be quiet. That made us pretty paranoid the rest of the evening. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: poncherello1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights Nov. 12-14 and just loved it. We stayed in a 26th floor Concierge suite which was immaculate and had a beautiful view of Downtown Dallas. The concierge lounge was closed for the weekend so I don't know what it was like. The restaurant was clean and efficient. The food was very good but somewhat pricey as is the case with all hotels. Wireless internet is free for all gold and platinum members. Downtown Dallas is less than a 5 minute drive and DFW airport is about a 15-20 minute drive with no traffic. While in town we dined at the Dakota Steakhouse located at 600 North Akard Street. I had one of the best bone in filets I have ever had. Definitely go there if you're looking for a great steak.

Reviews.Title: “Superior service!”
Reviews.Author: millrun26
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of location. We were attending a wedding downtown, but we have relatives in Lake Dallas. The location was perfect and convenient. The service is outstanding, and we had an incredible AAA rate. We will most definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and conveinent location to the Dallas Market Center”
Reviews.Author: abc713
Reviews.Content: Perfect location if you have business at the Dallas Market Center, not much else around. Hotel was nice and clean, staff very helpful. The one big complaint was very thin walls -- could hear everything that was happening in the room next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and quality”
Reviews.Author: pb4y
Reviews.Content: Easy check-in. Staff very helpful and available. Rooms are roomy and well appointed. Nice to have a refrig in the room as well as plenty of outlets. The resturant is being remolded so the only place to eat is the upstair resturant with a temp bar. Some confusion with wait staff on what tables they were assign so service was a little slow. This will inprove with the completion of the main resturant. Great business hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great View of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: MGrimes
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Dallas was a delight to experience. I stayed at this hotel for one night and thoroughly enjoyed my visit. It is off by itself, a mile or so outside of the downtown area. It is a tall building, and has a different, oval shaped construction. I stayed on the 17th floor. When I opened the curtains of my window, I was amazed with the view (see pictures). The beds were excellent along with a nice plasma, wide-screen T.V. There was also a L-shaped couch that provided extra lounging area for visiting. There is a rooftop pool and fitness area, as well as a deck for viewing the downtown area and out into the rest of wild Texas. The view is excellent, especially at night. This trip was highlited by meeting Dallas great Demarcus Ware.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: lillah19
Reviews.Content: This was a pleasant hotel with a very friendly and helpful staff. The room was large, attractively furnished and quite comfortable. A great value for the price. Overall, an enjoyable weekend and and I will definitely stay here again. There were just a few small issues that I noticed. There were several weddings/events in the hotel and the self parking was tough to come by and the spaces are small so many large SUVs were parked over the lines. Also, the roof top pool was very crowded and noisy LOTS of kids even later in the evening. This Renaissance is centrally located and particularly convenient if you are traveling out of Love Field.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull”
Reviews.Author: huskiesmom
Reviews.Content: Great location for the trade center. The room was very nice and we had a wonderful steak dinner our last day there.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get over the cold”
Reviews.Author: born1980
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Renaissance hotels and while they are always chic I just have never enjoyed staying in one due to the cold feeling they exude. During our stay there were loads of stuffy people attending an event at the Market Center so it made things ever worse. The pool is on the rooftop and overall very nice, although it was windy so the tables got blown everywhere. The Front Desk was friendly enough however it still felt very sterile and devoid of much excitement. I realize I should be their target demographic (around 30 making pretty good money); however I would take an Embassy Suites anytime over this. At least you get free drinks there.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: lajababu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on bubsiness for a night and the rate included free breakfast which was good. The hotel is a high rise with great view of city. Parking and internet were free, although the hotel bathroom was very cramped, rest of the room was spacious. Room had an upscale decor with HDTV. The view was great, not in downtown but close.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff - Nice Hotel - Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: AA4ME
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located right next to the market center and medical district and is conveniently located of 35 for easy access on and off the interstate. For the business traveler - staff greets you and gets you checked in quickly. For Marriott Rewards members, rooms have already been assigned and keys ready when you walk in the door to help expedite the process. Concierge lounge has a great staff and snacks that rotate on a daily basis. Nice to sit up on the 27th floor and look out at downtown Dallas in the evening. Plenty of room to stretch out and relax with two desktop computers and printers located in the lounge as well. For all travelers - Be sure you visit the pool above the 30th floor where the gym is located. and take a look at the view from the observation deck on top of the roof. Restaurants on site are on the expensive side so be prepared to eat out from time to time if you are on a budget. Food is fair onsite with a couple of very good choices in the seafood. The steak salad seems to be a favorite among frequent guest. Hotel is not located with restaurants in close proximity, either a short cab ride or take your own car. Staff is great at giving directions and even printing out maps. Room size varies given the design of the hotel. Smaller rooms are towards the end with larger rooms towards the middle. You stand a better chance of getter a larger with double bed request as opposed to a king bed. So if you want the room, go for the double. Room can also be a "little" noisy at times. Doors are heavy and loud. For some reason people tend to forget this at 2 in the morning. If you have a room with a connecting door, pretty good chance you can hear everything your neighbor says and does. Remember, this works both ways and they can hear you as well. Room are clean and neat. If you are staying at the hotel and there is an event at the market center, be prepared to look for parking as they hotels lot seems to become an overflow area for meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: dallasfan1000
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Renaissance for 5 nights. Just returned and I must say I really enjoyed my trip, partly due to the great people and service at the Renaissance! My mother even enjoyed her experience, and she is hard to please! The most convenient hotel to the Dallas Market Center, we even walked to the DMC one day. Windy that it was, we took the shuttle the remaining days to the show, and the front door men were so kind, quick and receptive when we needed to call the shuttle to come and pick us up after we had missed the regular schedule each morning. Also, We loved the breakfast buffet. Waking up to the hot and warm foods and fruits was a great way to start our morning. And Reuben, one of the wait staff for the breakfast buffet was fantastic! He was our waiter just about every morning. So personable and made sure we always had what we wanted and needed. The only 2 cons, which really wasn't a con for the Renaissance, just hotels in general, is that the 2 double bed rooms were booked when I reserved my room. Was guaranteed at least a King and possibly a doubles room after the second day, but when I checked in the hotel clerk offered me a 1 queen room. But that was quickly remedied, we did get a King room, and we did indeed "eventually" get our 2 doubles room on the 3rd night. Also, my mother mentioned being able to hear our neighbors each morning taking a shower. And one night actually hearing them talk in the other room, although not necessarily being able to make out the conversation, unless we "really" wanted to, lol!

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of luxury made it special”
Reviews.Author: anyajimt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a kid-free two days in Dallas to run a half-marathon. The Renaissance provided a wonderful place to relax after the challenge of the run. The location was very convenient to downtown, where our event took place. The room was extremely clean;the furniture and decor modern. Most importantly, the bed was VERY comfortable (all-white linens and bedspread). The high def flat screen tv was a plus; also enjoyed a his/her separate sink arrangement and closet across from the vanity sink.Everything that would be unsightly, like mini-fridge and coffee maker were nicely tucked away behind cabinets. We requested a view of downtown, but got the opposite side- not as nice, but ok. I'm sure the downtown view is spectacular if you can get it. The breakfast( that was additional cost) was very very good and was served in one of two restaurants in the lobby area- went with the buffet, which did not disappoint- tons of fresh fruit, great eggs..carbs were available, but certainly not the only choice. The coffee rocked! Coffee maker in room and complimentary coffee there was good as well. There was also a bar and a snack/magazine room in the lobby that we did not try. We utilized the internet access room and found everything in working order and comfortable. The pool/hot tub on the roof was being rennovated. The workout room looked very nice. The only complaint we have about our stay was the first night- night before the run when sleep was very important (happened to be a Sat night.): Guests keep returning in waves to their rooms until 3 am. They were very noisy in the hallways..heard all the talk and slamming doors- very annoying! The next night was quiet- though a bomb could have gone off and I was possibly too tired to have heard. I'm not sure what the hotel could do about this besides building thicker, more insulated walls...or putting up a "quiet please" sign. Overall, a very pleasant stay..esp if you have any downtown activities planned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tradewinns
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel several times now and the rooms are very clean and large with comfortable beds and good size bathrooms. The rooftop pool is wonderful and the fitness room is well stocked with equipment, cool towels, fruits and water. I also like that it is within walking distance of the Dallas Market Center and it does not require valet parking. Valet is available, but self parking is available right in front of and beside the hotel so you can save some money by not having to pay for valet. I will stay here often when I am in Dallas. My only tip is to request a room near the center of the hotel, due to its' unique shape the farther out you go, the smaller the room and then end rooms are quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Big, Modern Tube of Lipstick”
Reviews.Author: Brian_NVA
Reviews.Content: This hotel continues to be my favorite place to stay when doing work off I-35E near the split with 183. It looks like a big, modern tube of lipstick. Parking is free, check-in around 9:00 PM was friendly and efficient, and my room (2405) was nicely furnished, including a large flat screen TV. I suggest you ask for a room with a view of downtown Dallas, rather than the hospital complex (which is what I had this time). The Government rate is quite reasonable and included a free breakfast buffet, but they did ask to see a Government ID to get that rate. One negative that turned into a positive - when I went down at the start of the breakfast buffet (6:00 AM), the hot food wasn't ready. The waiter/host went out of his way to have the kitchen prepare for me eggs, bacon, potatoes, and toast, in addition to the cold foods available on the buffet... all complementary. He definitely turned a minus into a plus for me. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: artwriter
Reviews.Content: I think the street appeal of this hotel is outstanding. Thirty stories of granite loom above Dallas in an oval shape. When I saw it advertised with a weekend special, I reserved a room for our wedding anniversary. Although it is not a new hotel, our room had been recently renovated with style. The extra vanity outside the full bath was convenient though we didn't need it for this stay, it would be great if getting ready for a special event. We didn't want to leave the too cozy bed, it was so perfect with just the right support, tons of pillows and plush linens. I was offered the breakfast when making phone reservations, included for an up-charge of $15 per couple and I agreed, but after checking in and realizing the amount charged seemed too low, we asked the desk and they did not uphold the price. We were not overcharged for the room, but the breakfast buffet would have been $15 each had we chosen to do that. All in all we enjoyed a very pleasant stay in a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Might as well be in the same room with the people next door”
Reviews.Author: familytimevacati0n
Reviews.Content: Starting off, the big negative is that the walls are so thin and most have adjoining doors so noise travels at this hotel. We were woke up 3 of the 4 nights by noise. The first night was the worst, I honestly thought someone was yelling inside our room. The morning didn't prove to be any better. It was bad enough I asked to be moved to a different room. We were told no they were full. I called again when I put the receiver up to the door so they could hear how awful it was (cussing and racial slurs). So bad I was shocked. We had to switch to two queens as that was all that was available. The following nights were noise from the hall. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Hilton near by! Service was good in general. We were there during a cold spell so the bar and steak resturaunt were moved up a level to the breakfast resturaunt due to the cold. Strange. The lobby was freezing. For a Marriott it reminded me of a Fairfield without the free perks of breakfast and free internet. Office to use had all the printers out of order. Disappointing stay overall. My positive to offer was the free workout facility on the top floor. It was too cold to enjoy the pool or hot tub. There was free parking and plenty of it.

Reviews.Title: “Never judge a hotel by its cover”
Reviews.Author: noerfnoen
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks really awesome on the outside, and in the lobby, and even in the room. It looks nice, flat out. However, if you're at all like me, the back of my eyelids are the most preferable view when I'm traveling on business - a fact lost on the hotel's architects. I woke up this morning to the smell of bleach in my room. I'm not sure if it was a result of the horrible climate control system bleeding it into my room from another room that was being cleaned out, or if it permeated the walls via osmosis. Now, I may be spoiled from staying at the likes of Super 8 and Motel 6, but this was the loudest hotel I've ever stayed in. I'll start with the internal sounds: a) person in next room showering b) person in next room's cell phone going off repeatedly with nobody answering c) person in next room zipping their luggage d) person in next room BRUSHING THEIR TEETH (they did a good job - about 2 minutes of vigorous brushing was audible) e) every door on the floor slamming (This also caused my king sized bed to shake) f) what i ended up deciding was pipes passing water from flushed toilets above me - the first two nights i thought it was airplanes passing over head irregularly every few minutes (i think that was also happening) g) train with a crossing it honks for right across the parking lot - this one was probably the least annoying, i leave near a train anyhow and i'm used to this. This place seriously had the worst noise insulation I've ever experienced in my life at either hotel or motel. I've stayed at hostels that were significantly more quiet despite the amorous German couple in the same room. The climate control was horrible - after smelling the bleach and hearing all the noise, I decided the room just has too many holes in it to retain a stable temperature for too long. It was about 40f outside, and I had the thermostat set to 72. It would cool the room to 72, the A/C would cut off, and I could immediately feel the room begin to warm up, as if there were a large space heater hidden some where in the room. I ended up setting it to 65f - way too cold, but it at least didn't get so hot I was sweating. The wireless Internet service was horrible - unusable in fact. It was just overloaded; router dropped about 30% of packets on a full strength signal. They even firewalled outbound mail so I couldn't send any mail. Gotta stop all those spammers with rooms at the Marriot. I complained about this and they took the $13 a day charge off my bill. The staff was very friendly and helpful, no complaints there at all. The conference facilities (for which I attended) were also decent, no complaints there. Basically, the extreme focus on upscale appearance contrasted with the horrible actual "a good place to sleep when away from home" experience a hotel should ultimately be based around is sickeningly superficial and really annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiMattToronto
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel! Great View's of Downtown, and easy access to Hwy.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: sk84fungirl
Reviews.Content: I love TripAdvisor and need to do a much better job of posting reviews. Now, with that comment, let me get to the Renaissance Dallas. I stayed at this hotel from 9/28 through 10/2 and had a very enjoyable stay. The hotel is an extremely easy 20-minute drive from the airport. I did not use valet parking as there was ample space available at the hotel. I was there for business and worked a late shift each night. I returned to the hotel after midnight each day. I always felt safe although I was alone each night. Don't get me wrong, I am always alert as you should be anywhere. But there was noone lurking or any suspicious activity. The lobby was nicely decorated with a splash of red if I recall. The bar and resaurant was to the right of the lobby. I ate at the bar late Monday night. Service was a tad slow, but the food was pretty good. It was the same night as Dallas vs. Carolina so there were quite a few folks milling around. My profile indicates high floor away from elevators. I had a high floor (21), right next door to the elevator bank. My first thought was that heavy use in the A.M. would wake me. However, there was minimum activity during the hours I arrived each night, and not once in the mornings did they wake me. And while I was working in the rooms, I rarely even heard the elevator noise. I had two double beds. The beds were very comfortable. There was a corner couch with ottoman. Very nice touch and it was also comfortable. In addition there was a desk area to work from and a large flat screen TV. When you enter the room, the restroom and closet is immediately on your left with a sink area outside of the stall and shower area. Nice to have 2 sinks. My view was of the Children's Hospital area. However, I did not spend much time looking out of the window. Although a Marriott rewards member, I am not Platinum. However, my company was being welcomed as a new partner during the month of September. So I was granted access to the Club Level on 27. Now, this was the crown jewel of my visit. It is absolutely awesome with great views of downtown. I only made it for the evening appetizers once. They were decent. Sesame chicken strips, a variety of cheeses, and crackers. There was an honor bar and the water and non-alcoholic drinks were complimentary. There is also 2 computers and a printer available for use. I recall 2 very large TVs as well that I bet will be used a lot during football season. Breakfast is also available in the club level. I made it to breakfast the day of checkout. It was not a buffet. Eggs, bacon, sausage, bagels, etc were served. Best breakfast I've had in a Marriott club level room. I think it may also be referred to as the concierge level. During my stay I received a welcome call from Joanne Horn (Business Trvl Mgr) as well as a follow-up email. Very nice touch. Every staff associate I encountered was nice. If you cannot tell, I really enjoyed my stay. I'm hoping the company sends me back soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: Millyj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here this past labor day weekend for three nights for a family reunion. We are from Los Angeles, I really think we got more bang for our buck...We got the room at $79 a night vs. the $89 for the reunion rate. Nice light fixture in the middle of the hotel that takes you by surprise when you walk in...its like a thousand lights on the long twist of art that goes up the ceiling..very nice. There was a restaurant that I didn't try but I did sit in the bar area and had a nice glass of wine with some family. The rooms were GREAT...we had two queen beds with a corner sofa...very nice. Very roomy and modern. There was a fridge but no microwave and a plasma TV. The only thing that I did NOT like was the fact that there were four of us (a sixteen year old,1yr old as well as my husband and I) and the drawer space was a joke. There were only four drawers about 3-4inches in depth....I couldn't even pack 3 pair of neatly folded jeans comfortably to close them all the way. So we used what space we could with the drawers and just made due out of our suit cases. We had two banquet nights and the food was fairly good. The view was nice...We could see Dallas as well as planes taking off from the side of the hotel we were on...we were in in room 2307 on the 23rd floor. Nice view. good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome is the only word”
Reviews.Author: montiep
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance for our 33rd anniversary. This hotel was very nice, very friendly staff. We had a room without a view at first, the staff quickly moved us to a queen beds, with a view. After returning from the pool we wanted to nap. Hey, this is what the weekends are for right? Well the people in the next room were having a party or something. We tried the radio, but it would not help drown out the noise. I went downstaris and ask for our "other" room back as I knew at 12-1 in the morning we would not want to hear partying. Well, the very sweet rep gave us a suite on the 24 floor! The views were great, the bed sooo very comfy. We felt like royality. We had gone to a concert and were planning to go to a local bar for drinks after, but could not wait to get back to our special room. We opened the curtains wide, pulled some chairs over to the window, and just took it all in. The pool area is very nice, on the rooftop. THe gym had alot of machines, AND they had cool towlels in a mini fridge for your face. The employees were all very friendly and sure to please. I would reccomend this hotel in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - a little musty”
Reviews.Author: traveling1567933
Reviews.Content: The service when you arrive is on par with a 4 or 5 star hotel. Our room was on the 20th floor and faced the medical center. The room was a bit musty - probably difficult to air out on the 20th floor with 100 degree temps outside, but still a little bothersome. Beds are comfortable, pillow selection was wierd (they were of varying firmness, but all really small). The rooms had clearly been renovated, with really TVs, desks, nice sinks and closet doors, but old tub. Internet was $13/24h, but parking was free (valet is available, but i'm not sure for how much). The pool is on the top of the building and outside = really hot deck area and really warm water, at least in June. It's conveniently located to cute shopping areas and resturants (once you figure your way around). Would be 5 stars, but the musty smell was annoying (smelled like old socks). Also, there was a commuter train that went by with a horn that could be heard over the TV on the 20th floor, but seemed to have stopped by 10pm and didn't keep us awake or wake us up.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Masibfred
Reviews.Content: This hotel was like a breath of fresh air after my previous stay in a different hotel that i would describe as a breath of sewage. The rooms were clean. They gym had descent equipment. The view was pleasant. The rooms were nicely air conditioned without any loud noises. There was some noise in the halls but whatever that's a saturday night for you. The bar lounge was pretty nice too. Overall it was a really enjoyable experience. The breakfast was delicious too!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: txrus
Reviews.Content: Just finished 3 nights here working for a client in the local area. Due to my colleague's status w/Marriott, we were upgraded to the Club level w/connecting rooms. These have to be some of the biggest rooms I've seen in a hotel (see pictures), though the bathrooms are surprisingly small considering the size of the guest room. The bathroom is as wide as the bathtub is long, but there is a 2nd sink & vanity outside the bathroom proper in the dressing area which provides extra space. Beds wonderfully comfy; couldn't ask for more in that area. Newly renovated Club lounge on the 27th floor is simply gorgeous, though only open during set hours. Hot breakfast provided in the morning & appetizers during the evening, though the offering was somewhat smaller than expected. Plenty of complimentary juices, water, & sodas plus a small fridge in the guest rooms were very welcome. The only drawback to this property is its location-it's not the nicest area & there's not much around for dining options. Otherwise, a very nice stay & I would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: trollafdf
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 2 overnights at the Dallas Renaissance. We really enjoyed our short stay. The service was great and everyone that we came in contact with was helpful and made us feel welcome. The Club Lounge was convenient and cozy. Our room was on the 28th floor with a great view of downtown. We had a King room w/ a roll away for our 14 yr old daughter. She always objects to a roll away because they are usually cot like. The one that we received was really a twin bed on wheels without the bump in the middle. She said that it was nice and comfy. Our room was updated, modern and very clean. Tbones retaurant off of the lobby was overpriced for the quality but convenient after a long day. I wouldn't eat there again since it offered nothing special to demand the outrageous prices. I was surely not happy to pay 12.95 a day for internet access. Boo to that! Avoid the costly add ons and this is a wonderful place to stay in Dallas. We were in town to see the King Tut exhibit and to do some shopping. I hope to stay here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: AmandaOU
Reviews.Content: This hotel meets the basic requirements of a clean place to stay, but honestly did not meet my expectations. Despite many other reviewer's comments on the "beautiful rooms", I thought that the decorating scheme was not that great. In fact, I think that was the ugliest carpet I have ever seen (okay, not as bad as burnt orange shag carpet, but it was not good). The walls were really thin, so I could easily hear the neighbor's TV (and even another room's in the silent moments between commercials). The bathroom had a completely oversized vanity that dominated the room and blocked at least half the bathtub. The pool on the roof would have been great if the weather had been a bit warmer (FYI - it is a shallow pool, no more than 4 to 5 ft deep). The hot tub would have been just right had it been in operation over our 2 day stay, but it was out of service. This Marriott property also charges for internet access ($9.95 per day), which is completely ridiculous. To me, this is like charging for electricity or water...it should be built into the cost of the room. We did stay on the Club level and had access to the lounge, which gets you breakfast in the morning and snacks in the evening. Overall, it is a clean place to sleep, but not exactly what I expected.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal and a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAtraveler57
Reviews.Content: We were there to visit King Tut exhibit. Upon check in the lady at the desk told us of another package deal for our second night that saved us $50.00 right then. The hotel is beautiful, rooms are clean and newly redone. It was too cold for the pool but it is on the roof where there is a view of downtown. Hotel is five minutes from the westend. You can't walk anywhere but driving to downtown was a cinch. Breakfast buffet was included in each night's package and it was great as well. There was a little dust on things in the room or I would have give five stars there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, pretty good”
Reviews.Author: haphazardraveller
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Renaissance on several occasions, for various purposes, and while I've never been overwhelmed, it's definitely a hotel I'd recommend. It's always clean, with attentive staff and speedy service. Parking is steep, but self-park is an option- and you don't have to cross any streets on foot to do it. This hotel is convenient to the hospitals, and just a couple of minutes from downtown Dallas. One of the reasons I rated this place above average is the breakfast. I don't usually have any other meals there, but the full-service breakfast is exceptional for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, great technology, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Homat
Reviews.Content: Outside, this oval-shaped high-rise building looks architecturally interesting. Inside, my room was large, clean and well optimized for the needs of the business traveller with an advanced electronics console (combining a power bar with jacks allowing a PC to plug into the TV, which was a large-screen flat-panel LCD unit). There is a good bar and decent restaurant in the hotel, important because there's not much around the property within walking distance (I could see central Dallas from my window, but in the distance as this hotel is on the way from DFW airport towards - but not in - the downtown area). Service was fast, friendly, and accurate. My room service breakfast was excellent, although the huge food portions of were larger than â€˜Texas-sized.â€™ I also liked the combination clock radio and iPod bedside unit. A lot of hotels seem to be phasing-out radios, but this one was brand new and worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: pbark
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here I had high hopes for my stay at the Renaissance. The hotel is beautiful and well kept. The rooms and hallways are updated with nice fixtures and decorations. My room however was extremely small for the price. I've paid a lot less for larger room that was just as nice in Marriott properties. The staff was friendly and the business center was useful. There is free and valet parking available. I just wish the room would have been a more comfortable size. I will definitely try a different hotel on my next stay in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: preamble
Reviews.Content: This Renaissance is very nice. My room was fresh and contained great appointments. I was upgraded to a suite, which had an amazing living room, complete with HDTV and very cool lamps. The best part of the stay, however, was breakfast. Their breakfast buffet is probably the best meal I've had in a Marriott hotel, hands down. They had these breakfast baguettes that were to die for. Yum! This hotel is also close to the Uptown area of Dallas, which is good for younger travelers who seek to experience Dallas nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I paid for”
Reviews.Author: Gizkmo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with a great staff, but the "club level" room rate is basically a rip off. The hotel website promises Marble and brass fixtures, we got chrome and Formica, they promise bathrobes, Starbucks coffee, and a CD player alarm clock, we never saw that, They offer our choice of Mineral water, chardonnay, or Merlot on arrival with chips and sauce or mixed nuts, never got that either. It was a nice room in a great hotel, but I feel like if I pay for something I should get it. I felt ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: whighamkids
Reviews.Content: Pros: My husband and I actually stayed there last night to celebrate our anniversary! We booked through Priceline and bid $95. The hotel was newly renovated and very nice! We were on the 20th floor, so our view was also wonderful. Modern features, clean, friendly staff. Great amenities in the room (huge TV, mini fridge, good shampoo, etc.) Wonderful rooftop pool and hot tub. We loved it! -one more thing....we saw celebrities in the lobby! Cons: There is only one....it was very loud at night because of our neighbors. The rooms were not well insulated and you could hear what was going on all around. That's the only negative thing.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never go back”
Reviews.Author: divefan
Reviews.Content: The rooms are done in cheap, tacky modern. The TV didn't work. The internet signal was so weak it was useless. They must not have service elevators, because the elevator areas were constantly crammed with towel carts and other cleaning gear. The walls were so thin I could hear the people talking next door about what they were going to eat for breakfast, and I could hear them zipping their suitcases. The only good thing was the breakfast tacos.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Deal Here!”
Reviews.Author: Goteed1
Reviews.Content: In the middle of 2 night stay here, bid throug Priceline at $68 a night, which is a steal I think considering all this place has to offer. Travelocity rate was $109 which is still not a bad deal for this place. The hotel must have been renovated recently, my room on the 16th floor had awesome view, room is gorgeous, high end finishes everywhere, incredible king bed, great desk, nice furniture, TWO sinks, nice bathroom. Nice big flat screen TV. Room has a fridge (look in a bedside cabinet!) Found the coffeemaker in another cabinet. Self parking is FREE!! First time ever I've been to a major chain that free parking. Service here is OUTSTANDING, kudo to the mgmnt for trying so hard to please, it's obvious. Some nitpicks - Maid service was late in the day, I'm guessing it's because the hotel has a Mary Kay convention going on (lots of women in pink!) Also the Gym which I always use in hotels has some okay cardio equipment but otherwise is really very JackLalanne circa 1972. Pool is nice on the roof, hardly any lounges to lay on though. Also because it's so high they walled off the view I guess to keep drunken guests from falling off. Also, wifi is free in the lobby and public spaces, but in your room it's dial up (the room comes with a cable modem) Haven't seen that in a while. Direct TV service goes off every so often. Anyhow this place is great, wouldn't hesitate to come back or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Renovated rooms are very nice”
Reviews.Author: Mark343
Reviews.Content: Hotel is being renovated and new rooms are nice and spacious. Bright carpeting, flat screen TVs, modern furniture. I thought it was a deal at about $100/night on a package from Orbitz.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Austinrunnergirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine. The check in girl was a little snooty, but the rooms were clean with a good view. The Renaissance in Plano is much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Meet Marriott Standards”
Reviews.Author: MachOne002
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I am an elite member and have always been extremely pleased with the Marriott brands. Even after reading other negative reviews, I decided to stay here rather than at the Marriott Suites across the interstate. Although the suites had many rave reviews, I chose the Renaissance for the view and the package deal (Escape! Shopping). For only $159 a night, I got an Executive Suite that included a late night snack with wine and continental breakfast. The snack had to be requested each night 30-60 minutes ahead of time and was different each night. To enjoy the continental breakfast, you had to go the hotel restaurant only to receive cereal!!! Now for the service and staff of the hotel or lack thereof. Upon arrival, I was checked-in in an almost rushed fashion. There was no recognition of my elite status or welcome gift as with most other hotels. When entering the room, it was spacious, but slightly dated and worn. There were two beer caps on the floor and a rather humorous white stain on the seat of the desk chair. My request of a downtown view was not honored. The bed was extremely comfortable. The bathroom was on the small side, but amenities were wonderful. I am planning on purchasing some of the Lather products. On my second night in the hotel, the shower handle broke and rendered the shower unusuable. I immediately called to have it fixed. After an hour, the engineer left to look for a replacement part. We were leaving to enjoy the Saturday night and I stopped at the front desk to request a phone call if we needed to move. The rude staff informed me that I just needed to check the front desk when I got back, even if it was late and they would tell me if I needed to move. I did this and at 2am was told I would be moving. I had to request assistance with my bags!!! The only good side was that I finally got a view of downtown, but no other apologies were made for the inconvenience. Once in a functional room, pleasant sounds of drilling and hammering provided an unrequested wakeup each morning at around 8:30 and throughout the entire day until around 4. At checkout, an error with the bill (phone & internet charges) had to be fixed. Once again, the staff made no attempt to apologies and did not act as if you were a valued customer at all. Gathering from the patrons of the hotel bar, this hotel is primarily a place for Southwest Airlines employees to stay so they aren't concerned about making any good impressions. Overall, the rooms are okay, but slightly dated and damaged. The staff could've come straight from a Comfort Inn as far as I'm concerned. Everyone from the front desk to the engineer to the bartender showed unpleasant and rude behavior. The maid service was friendly though. I would NOT recommend this hotel unless you get a package deal and even then, don't expect anything more than a place to sleep. They couldn't care less about how enjoyable your stay is.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but just some notes...”
Reviews.Author: Pulaskicountytourism
Reviews.Content: Over all enjoyed my stay. Very clean. Staff was great and very friendly. The toliet wouldn't flush in my room but they fixed it within a couple of hours. Room was large. Be prepared, food is pretty pricey at T-Bones the steak/seafood restaurant in the lobby. But the food was very good. As far as I can tell there really isn't any other restaurants within safe walking distance, other than a Denny's I can just make out in the distance on past several large empty parking lots. Steaks run $30 on up (And I mean just the steak) Then you have to pay $8 for a potato, $8 for a salad, $6 for 6 aspargus spears $3 for a glass of tea...So be prepared. Atleast I haven't ate alot of carbs while on this trip. There is really nothing around close by (walking distance) except the convention center/market area and major roadways. There is some sort train that runs back and forth that you can hear in your room. Be sure to fly into Lovefield. Cab fares are under $20 but if you fly into the other airport you are looking at about $50. Another person mentioned the 2 flight climb to the pool area. The fitness area is up there too. It is a strange climb, metal stairs and such. Compared to all the granite and the italian chandelier it's a bit shocking to see this part of the hotel. Non smoking hotel which is fine. But what is nice they have a little patio area to the right of the front doors with tables and chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: intime011
Reviews.Content: My husband I have stayed here a few times. We love the view as well as the free breakfast. We are platinum members and usually always get a free upgrade without question. This is a fun relaxing place to spend a few hours of downtime. Room service is open until midnight, which is also nice. I love the larger King room! The work out room is a bit scary getting there, I don't recommend you go alone. But if you just want a very comfortable place to relax, and enjoy the view, I highly recommend the Renaissance Dallas Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Setti21
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic weekend in Dallas and the Renaissance. Staff were really friendly and helpful and the view from the room was simply spectacular. You wouldn't walk from the hotel to downtown, but it's only a few minutes away by car. I was expecting a little bit of a dated hotel, but everything was in tip-top shape. Clean, comfortable and the staff make all the difference for me. They're happy to advise you on where to go and what to do.

Reviews.Title: “GET THE PACKAGE!”
Reviews.Author: hollymww
Reviews.Content: GET THE PACKAGES! Great price for all you get! Romance package- which includes, dinner at T-BONES which is the best STEAKS! You get appetizer, salad, entree, bread, drink, and desert. NOT ONE by the way. 2! 2 appetizers, 2 salads, etc. all included! Free breakfast buffet which is excellent! Champagne and snack. like chips salsa etc. we got the alcohol and chips at night after dinner around midnight stayed up and had fun. We wnt for my husbands birthday- and we will return! Actually already booked for Feb 08 for VDAY! Price was 249 for one night- BUT if your going for a quiet weekend alone- this is great package. we didnt need to leave the hotel! Also, 25th floor suite, with parlor room king bed. CANT BEAT it anywhere. TRUST me I looked! Travel agent Holly

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't disappointed at all”
Reviews.Author: mutigerbell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while attening the Cotton Bowl game New Years Day! Our room was nice, clean and had an amazing view of downtown. Check in was fast, friendly and easy. The staff was very accommodating and we didn't have any trouble whatsoever. We had our free appetizers and drinks delivered promptly to our room and the free breakfast was great as well. Overall what a nice stay and a Mizzou win!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Matty07uk
Reviews.Content: Stayed last night on visit. Location was fine as wanted close to American Airline Center. Room on 30th floor meant good view but we were back of hotel so no City lights. Good view from the roof top pool. Had wine in the room on arrival but was for someone else, we informed reception but took about 40 minues to collect and not even a thanks, should have drunk the wine! Decor in bedroom was a bit dated and room and corridors indicated hotel needed refurbishing. No bedding for sofa bed and took 2 attempts by room service to deliver, first time just gave us 1 sheet! Plus we needed to move the furniture for the bed to be extended. Breakfast was okay but again Marriott Suites was better. Hotel shuttle was fine for getting to Airline Center and picked us up after Texas Stampede. Overall disppointing as had expected to be of a higher standard than Marriott Suites but didn't match.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown view”
Reviews.Author: miredintx
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a two-night stay to visit the Texas State Fair. The location is not great (several miles from downtown) unless you have business at the nearby Market Center. We chose it for the weekend rate and location near freeway. Check-in was easy.........but flawed. We requested a king-bed room and the check-in person verified the room we were given was in fact "a king-bed room with a downtown view." NOT........ When we arrived at the room, the first thing I noticed were TWO beds. It wasn't a big deal since the room was rather large and easily accommodated the two queen beds. But, it wasn't what I asked for or was just told 5 minutes before that I was receiving. So, I went back to the lobby where I was given what I asked for. How do these things happen? The room was clean, excellent bed and bath. The breakfast buffet was decent. All-in-all a typically slightly above average business hotel. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: achristie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. Great view from my room on the 30th floor. Bed was comfortable, lots of fluffy towels. Room service fairly prompt, food hot and delicious. Attractive lobby. Would love to stay here again, nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Rachel2450
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend coming from Washington, DC to see the Cowboys game during home opening weekend. The hotel is close to Texas Stadium and the West end area of Dallas. The hotel staff was very efficient and helpful. Hotel looks great from the outside and the lobby, bar and restaurant area had an upscale feel without being pretentious at all. The rooms are standard but very clean and it is nice to have two sink areas when staying with two people. The bed was very comfortable--down comforter and lots of pillows. TV is small. Room service offers a fairly good selection but as always, a bit pricey. We had a room on the 23rd floor and the view of downtown was great. Try Breadwinners cafe and bakery on McKinney for brunch or breakfast, its a great cafe/lunch place that tons of locals seem to frequent. You will have to wait but it was worth it. The only (-) of this hotel was that the lobby smelled strangely like beef. This is because of the steakhouse on the main floor but it is a weird combination of hotel cleaner smell mixed with beef every time you walk in....maybe they could get a better venting system in that restaurant. Other than that it was a great hotel and I would stay there again. Also--free parking. Get a rental car or you will feel isolated. Go Cowboys!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: alwayslovn
Reviews.Content: Very accomodating staff and wonderful scenery. The rooms were superior and very clean. The housekeeping staff was very attentive. The valet gentlemen were willing to help in any way to make sure that we arrived at every destination on time. I felt very welcomed the whole weekend. Thank you for the wonderful experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “okay for price but renovations coming in Sept.”
Reviews.Author: travelingfamily5
Reviews.Content: Beautiful lobby. Marriott rewards offered a service to honor special requests for towels, pillows, reservations, etc., but ours were not honored upon arrival. I had to call desk 4 hours later. Bathroom vanity was cracked and the toilet leaked which explained the horrific B.O. smell. The only room to move to had no city view which my kids loved. From now on, I'll pack Lysol spray! We booked the bed and breakfast for an additional $10 which was well worth it because the bill for 5 breakfast buffets would have been $51. Without a breakfast deal, go to nearby Denny's or IHOP. Pool was horrible and freezing eventhough the front desk insisted the heater was on. Cigarette butts were all in the pool! VERY convenient to West End, Galleria, historic district, etc. especially via the tollway. With all the options in Dallas, I won't choose this one again. We changed our reservations for Sept. to another 4 star since the Ren. is starting "major renovations" in Sept. - beware.

Reviews.Title: “It was decent”
Reviews.Author: ry0ohki
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance is a very pretty, centrally located hotel. The lobby and restaurant are both very nice. The rooms themselves were decent, although the bathrooms are sorely in need of a remodel. Both me and another business companion found the bathtubs to be dirty (they may be stained). But the bathtubs at motel 6's have always looked nicer then here. The staff is very helpful and friendly, and the cafe downstairs is good for coffee in the morning. Another negative is that the Renaissance feels a need to gouge you on prices for little things. Internet is $10 a day, although it is fast and works well. Don't expect to save money buying water in the lobby, they only sell $4.33 Norwegian artesian water (Tastes like tap water to me).

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: Bearpig
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay (3 days) at the Renaissance Dallas Hotel with our Marriotts Rewards points. This gave us a great upgrade to a suite from a standard room, with breakfast included. The suite was very spacious and of a good standard, although it was somewhat dated (looking about 10yrs old). That said, the room was clean, generally well maintained (apart from a few very minor issues that were not a problem) and well serviced each day. The hotel itself as many have stated before is a nice hotel in a very average location. There are no good restaurants or bars within a 5 minute drive, although the West Village area is about 10 minutes drive, and has everything a visitor to Dallas could want - bars, restaurants, shopping and much more. Back to the hotel, we had breakfast each morning, where the staff couldn't have been any more helpful - very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was a good selection, although I would recommend not leaving it too late as we got there around 9am one day and a lot of stuff had gone. Scrambled eggs, bacon, waffles, fresh fruit, pastries, yoghurts - a good varied choice. The pool on the roof looks better in pictures - in reality it looks quite tired and would benefit of some redecoration (a bit like a lot of the hotel really!). That said, it was again clean and useable, so it served a purpose. A good useful feature for us was the guest laundry room. Completely free use of the washer, dryer and free powder. For us it was great to do a spot of laundry before our trip to California, so very grateful for this facility. Overall we would recommend it for the facilities and friendly service, but I'm sure there are nicer hotels in Dallas, but I imagine they aren't cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: RedDragon17
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at the Renaissance Hotel in Dallas, TX. The room was comfortable and the bed was too. The pillows could've been a littler firmer, but overall it was a good hotel. The room was clean. The pool area was a little crowded (on the 30th floor of the bldg) with hardly any space. Staff was friendly and helpful. The restaurant in the hotel was also very good. My only complaint was that I could hear the neighbors next door at 5am--it was a loud and an interesting awakening.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: NJdudette
Reviews.Content: My sister and I had a wonderful experience at the Renaissance in Dallas. Itâ€™s only a ten minute drive to downtown during the non-rush hour times of day and it offers wonderful views of downtown. The hotel staff was very accommodating when I advised them of my late arrival and requested that my sister be added to my reservation so that she could check-in to the hotel ahead of me. Due to problems with the weather it took my sister longer than expected to drive up from Austin to Dallas, therefore, she never got a chance to check-in to the hotel and instead she drove right to the airport to pick me up. When we finally checked in it was so late that I never thought to ask for a room with a nice view even though I had requested one at the time I made my reservation. We were not disappointed â€“ we were given a room on the 25th floor with a nice view of downtown. The room was large enough for up to four people with two queen sized beds and a small sitting area. The dÃ©cor was neutral and the furniture didnâ€™t appear to be too beat up while the carpet did have more than a few stains. The smell of fresh paint permeated the floor, although, our room didnâ€™t appear to have been recently painted. The bathroom itself was a bit on the small side, but with a sink in and outside of the bathroom it made life a bit easier. The room was extremely clean and we found the staff to be very friendly. With temps in the low 80â€™s we decided to checkout the roof top pool and discovered their website photos are a bit deceiving. The pool furniture was old and not very aesthetically pleasing. The pool itself wasnâ€™t horribly dirty, but I think it could have been a tad bit cleaner. I realize not many business folk are into taking a dip in a hotel pool, but I do think thereâ€™s more they could have done to make it more eye appealing. All in all we enjoyed our stay and I wouldnâ€™t hesitate in recommending it to someone else or staying there myself again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bellarina126
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is close enough to downtown with easy access to all the major freeways throughout the metroplex. The new beds are incredible and the rooms are nice. The parking leaves a little to be desired, but it was adequate. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooftop pool was very warm and the terrace offered great views of the Dallas skyline. Altogether another wonderful Marriott experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DNAW
