Reviews.Content: This hotel is near the Market Center and Love Field and isn't far from the down town area, making it very convenient. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the door men know you after staying there one time. The bedding is comfy with down covers and pillows. There is an extra sink and mirror which is great for two people sharing a room. It is clean and they are generous with bathroom linens. The view is beautiful at night if you are high enough and facing downtown. The T-Bones Steak Restaurant is very good whether you are eating a full meal, or prefer a salad and soup. Their tortilla soup is wonderful. I would definitely recommend this hotel for any one traveling alone or with business partners.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I could have imagined”
Reviews.Author: msneil46
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Renaissance Dallas Hotel while it town one weekend. I LOVED IT!! this property is everything it promotes itself to being. The lobby was inviting and the staff very friendly. The room was immaculate with very comfortable beds. We also had a great view of downtown Dallas. This stay was a treat and we will be back

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: Gixxer
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Reasonable priced. We stayed 2 night just to get away from home since we live locally. Room was very nice. Wife loved the bed. Room service was fast. Only ate breakfast at the restaurant so can't rate the food. Pool was not the best. A little dirty and the chlorine was too high. Pool is on the roof top so it is windy up there. Hot tub did not get hot even after 1.5 hours of being on. It is a 5 minute drive to downtown but one cannot walk to downtown which could be important to some travellers. Overall good but need a few improvements.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, but overbooked”
Reviews.Author: SheWhoWanders
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last week and was overall pleased, but there were some problems. The front desk staff was marginally helpful - I was waiting outside for a cab and they were complaining about customers in front of other guests. The hotel was full so there was about a 3 elevator run wait in the mornings and evenings. The room was nice - wonderful pillows. My wake-up call was late (and I had to catch a flight) - luckily I also set my cell phone alarm. The hotel bar is very nice but expensive, the pool is on the roof (about the 31st floor) so it was very windy, the internet was very quick but there was a $9.95 charge per day. I would stay here again but it was not outstanding - the hotel is just getting older...

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal/Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: docbfree
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend at the Renaissance. Was very impressed by the room and service. Especially for the price. Booked a weekend special that included a 2 room suite, King Bed, and full Breakfast. Price was $139. Service was great and friendly. When I say breakfast, I mean the whole thing..made to order omelettes, fresh fruit including kiwi/boysenberries,(not canned peaches). Great exercise room. Small rooftop pool. Would definitely return and feel any rate below $160 to be very good.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: fritzco97
Reviews.Content: I recently spent one night at the Renaissance Dallas. I enjoyed the stay. The service was excellent. I'm a Marriott Rewards Platinum level guest, which entitles me to an upgraded room. That doesn't always get taken care of before all the suites are filled with other guests. In this case, though, the front desk blocked me out an upgraded room ahead of time, and I had a wonderful suite with a skyline view. They seemed very willing to accomadate requests, Platinum or not. Check in was very smooth, despite a 2AM arrival. The one meal I had was very good. I would agree with the previous comments that there's not much around other than other hotels. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated hotel”
Reviews.Author: rainierv
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Renaissance Dallas for a conference. Check-in was quick. I had a small corner room with a view of Downtown Dallas. Size was okay considering I was traveling by myself. Non-smoking room had a smoky smell. Decorations in room and bathroom were very outdated. The bar on the first floor was decent. Be careful of food. Not sure if it was the food our conference organizers ordered, but the main meals were awful. Snacks were good. On the second day of the conference, I knew to load up during snack time since the main meals were a toss-up.

Reviews.Title: “The Renaissance is not a tourist destination”
Reviews.Author: pilarkitty
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really nice, but there was NOTHING around within walking distance. It is located within a cluster of other hotels so there must be a reason for this, but I couldn't figure it out. It must be for business travellers. The chips and salsa at the bar were incredible! Yum! The breakfast bar was good, but it was $15/person. Try to get a room rate with breakfast included. Our room was rather small, but the view was breathtaking from the 19th floor. They even had nice Bath and Body Works shampoo, conditioner, and body wash. It's rare to even have conditioner supplied to you at a hotel. I was impressed, but it doesn't take much. If I am ever in Dallas again for businees, I would stay here. If I was there to sight see, I would find a different location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: Britjuan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very user-friendly. Staff is very knowledgeable and helpful. The room is clean and comfortable. The only complaint is overhead lighting in the room; however this was not a problem in the daytime when we opened our draperies on the 10th floor. 2 minutes away from the American Airlines Arena, great restaurants are close. Will be staying here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Renaissance Dallas Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 2222 Stemmons Freeway, Dallas, TX 75207
